'''Britney Dickinson''', using the alias Betty Nelson, is the birth mother of [[Leo Hunt|Leo]].



During soccer playoffs, Betty tore her ACL. She had surgery to repair it and was given ten days' worth of opioids for the pain. She ended up addicted to them and moved on to other drugs when they ran out.


Betty got pregnant by a drug dealer and gave birth to [[Leo Hunt|Leo]]. At some point after his birth, he was put into foster care and went to live with [[Owen Hunt]].


When Leo got his six-month well-baby checkup, Betty was told she could come and she did. While he was getting a shot, Betty stepped out of the room and talked to Amelia, who offered to buy her breakfast. While they were eating, Betty told Amelia what had happened that led to her life being how it was. In response, Amelia decided to take Betty in and help her get and stay clean. When Betty showed up to come home with her, Amelia laid out the rules for her and then they went home with Owen and Leo. ''("[[Bad Reputation]]")''


Amelia helped Betty get through her detox, which involved lots of vomiting. Betty was angry with Amelia and took the withdrawal out on her, which Amelia said was fine. Amelia became worried when Betty was spending a long time in the bathroom, she went to check on her and found that Betty had left out the window. ''("[[Fight For Your Mind]]")''


Betty came back to Owen's house. She said she'd been clean for six days and missed Leo. Amelia took her to work and kept Betty in her sight all day. Betty later confessed that she'd been too high to miss Leo and came back because she got cold, which Amelia already knew. She then took Betty to a meeting. ''("[[Cold as Ice]]")''


The day of Alex and Jo's wedding was the day Betty got her -day chip from AA. Neither of her parents came to the ceremony despite Amelia inviting them. Betty then went to the wedding with Owen and Amelia. After the wedding planner ended up having an allergic reaction to shrimp and was sent to the hospital, the wedding party and guests then boarded a ferry, where Alex and Jo were married by Meredith. ''("[[All of Me]]")''


After the wedding, she continued to live with Owen, Amelia, and Leo and the four of them settled into a rhythm. ''("[[With a Wonder and a Wild Desire]]")''


Amelia became upset and fought with Betty when she believed Betty was doing drugs and lying about it. She took Betty to work with her for a drug test, but still wasn't sure what she should do. Amelia then talked to Owen's mother about how to be a good parent to Betty. She went back to Betty, who admitted to having smoked weed. Amelia reminded her that drug addicts can't do that, because if you smoke weed, you might forget not to do heroin. ''("[[Momma Knows Best]]")''


After Amelia read a text from Betty's phone about her skipping class, Amelia convinced Owen to wait with her outside Betty's school to see if she would leave during the day. When they saw Betty leaving with two friends, Owen got their attention and waved, which encouraged them to go back to school. ''("[[Everyday Angel]]")''


Soon after, Amelia dropped Betty off at school one morning and then the school called and told her Betty hadn't come to school that day. Amelia came back to Owen's to check if Betty was there, but she wasn't, so she, Owen, and Teddy spread out to look for her, but at the end of the day, she was still missing. ''("[[Flowers Grow Out of My Grave]]")''


During the wind storm, Betty came into the ER with a cut on her head. She openly admitted to Amelia that she was high and said she really did want to get better. Amelia was angry with her, but came to the ER, hugged her, and told her to come back always. She also decided to become Betty's foster mom officially. ''("[[Blowin' in the Wind]]")''

When Richard found Betty wandering the hospital, he said that he fights cravings by helping people and invited her to help him treat patients. When she started talking about staying clean and getting her life back on track, he advised her not to think she was cured just because she was making good progress. Later, he found her searching cabinets for drugs. He told her they were kept in a locked cabinet. Amelia later talked to Betty and said she needed to be ready to accept Amelia's help and help herself and to get her to that point, Amelia found her a bed at a rehab facility. Betty agreed to have Amelia drive her there. ''("[[Shelter from the Storm]]")''


When Owen and Amelia went to visit Betty in rehab, Betty said that one of the steps in rehab is to apologize and tell the truth. Betty said that she had been lying to Owen and Amelia all along and that her real name is Britney. Betty said she ran away when she got pregnant with Leo because she was afraid her parents would take Leo from her. ''("[[Girlfriend in a Coma]]")''


After telling Amelia the truth, Betty ran away from rehab after calling her parents to tell them where she was. ''("[[I Walk the Line]]")''


Betty and her boyfriend, [[Linus]], took meth and then went to the park, where they got opioids. They both overdosed and were taken to the hospital, where they were directed to the clinic because they both seemed stable. Once she realized where she was, Betty asked Linus to get their clothes so they could leave, but then she suddenly started having chest pains. She was moved to the hospital, where they found an aortic dissection. She was rushed into surgery. After a difficult operation, Betty's parents were told she'd be okay. She was stable and awake afterward, but unaware that Linus had died while she was in surgery. ''("[[I Want a New Drug]]")''


Two weeks after her heart surgery, Betty prepared to leave town to go home with her parents and Leo. She refused to say goodbye to Amelia before they left. Later, they returned to give Leo back to Owen, saying Betty wanted to be a kid and be able to make mistakes and live her life, which she couldn't do if she had to be Leo's mom. ''("[[We Didn't Start the Fire]]")''



She became romantically involved with [[Linus]] while they were in rehab together. She confided in him that she worried that when people learned her drug dealer had gotten her pregnant at fifteen that no one would love her and he promised to love her forever. ''("[[I Want a New Drug]]")''


She has a son named Leo who was in foster care and later adopted by [[Owen Hunt]].


She has friends named Rachel and Eileen, whom Amelia says seem like nice girls. ''("[[Everyday Angel]]")''


*She played high school soccer until she tore her ACL.<ref>[[Bad Reputation]], x</ref>
*She attends Landes High School.<ref>[[Flowers Grow Out of My Grave]], x</ref>
*As a child, she loved soccer, school, fuzzy socks, and cinnamon toast.<ref>[[I Walk the Line]], x</ref>
*She's afraid of blood, being home alone in the dark, falling into a frozen lake, and that she'd always have to tell people her dealer got her pregnant at fifteen.<ref>[[I Want a New Drug]], x</ref>
*She is allergic to shrimp.

'''Bill Pierce''' is the father of [[Maggie Pierce]].



Bill came to Seattle to comfort Maggie after her mother died. Richard sent a helicopter for him and met him on the roof. Although Bill wanted to reimburse the hospital for the expense of the helicopter ride, Richard refused to accept, stating that bringing Bill to the hospital was family business. Richard then led Bill to Diane's room, where Maggie was hugging her mother's body while Amelia and Meredith sat with her. When she saw him, Maggie got up and hugged her father. ''("[[Be Still, My Soul]]")''


Bill returned to Seattle when Maggie called him to come for her wedding. She had realized that her wedding would never be perfect because her mother wouldn't be there, so she invited her father and Winston's grandmother to come to Seattle for a small wedding. ''("[[I'm Still Standing]]")''

On the day of Maggie and Winston's backyard wedding, Bill and Antoinette objected. They said they'd been waiting for this for their kids' entire lives and wanted them to do it right. They said they should wait and get married when things started opening up again. Maggie and Winston easily agreed and postponed the wedding. In April , a new wedding took place on the beach with a much larger guest list. ''("[[Someone Saved My Life Tonight]]")''


Maggie went to visit her father when he had surgery on his hip. ''("[[Some Kind of Tomorrow]]")''



He was married to [[Diane Pierce]]. During their marriage, she had a long-term affair with the man who fixed their car. They eventually split up over it.

For their twentieth anniversary, he took dance lessons. ''("[[Harder, Better, Faster, Stronger]]")''

{{Intern and Resident Infobox |name = Blake Simms |image = x-.jpg |status = Alive |parents = Parents \u |grandparents = [[Lorraine Simms]] |title = M.D. |job = [[General Surgery|Surgical]] [[Resident]] |workplace = '''Current'''
[[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]] '''Former'''
[[Johns Hopkins Hospital]] |first appearance = '''[[Grey's Anatomy|GA]]:''' [[Back in the Saddle]] |last appearance = '''[[Grey's Anatomy|GA]]:''' [[Life on Mars?]] |only appearance = '''[[Station |S]]:''' [[I Know This Bar]] |count = |seasons = *'''[[Grey's Anatomy|GA]]:''' [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]] *'''[[Station |S]]:''' [[Season (Station )|]] |portrayed by = [[Devin Way]] }} '''Blake Simms''' is Tom's prot\ueg\ue. Blake came to Seattle with Tom to work at Grey Sloan Memorial. He participated in a resident skills lab regarding the case of [[Wade Foltz]]. He and Andrew made the diagnosis faster than the other residents, but during the practical part of the lab, he didn't win entry into the surgery, having been beaten by both [[Taryn Helm]] and [[Andrew DeLuca]]. Instead of that surgery, he went to the ER and helped work on [[Reid Kim]] while they were attempting to resuscitate him. He left that case when Tom came in and told him to go to another room where they weren't wasting time trying to save a patient who was already dead. ''("[[Back in the Saddle]]")'' When an article came out that condemned the healthcare industry, stemming from a list of possible article topics Meredith floated to a publisher, the residents discussed it in the locker room while getting ready for their days. Taryn liked the article and said Meredith was a badass for writing it, but Blake warned them that while he had Hopkins and Koracick on his resum\ue, they might have difficulty finding other jobs. ''("[[It's Raining Men]]")'' On the day of Meredith's hearing, Blake and the other residents were told they'd have to up their game to make up for the missing attendings. At the end of the day, the residents were all exhausted from the extra work they'd done. Blake then announced that Levi had been the one to turn Meredith's fraud in, turning the other residents against him. ''("[[My Shot]]")'' On Meredith's first day back at work, Blake and the other residents greeted her with a cake. Afterward, they went on rounds, where they worked on the case of [[Jamie Caldwell]], which Blake followed to its end. ''("[[Let's All Go to the Bar]]")'' While Blake was at the bar with some other residents, a car crashed through a window and into the bar. ''("[[Let's All Go to the Bar]]")'' Blake was seriously injured in the crash, with multiple facial fractures and bleeding that was obstructing his airway. They moved him to his side and packed his nose, but he later started choking on the blood, forcing them to do a cricothyrotomy to give him an airway. They ventilated him and when the firefighters finally got a doorway unblocked, he was the first patient put on a gurney and pulled out to get to the hospital. ''("[[I Know This Bar]]")'' Blake was taken to the ER, where they did a head CT, which showed no traumatic brain injuries. They rushed him into surgery to repair his facial fractures. After they were finished, they went to stitch him back up, but Owen noticed clear fluid around a blood stain, indicating a leak of cerebrospinal fluid. Tom found the source of the leak and repaired it. His grandmother was then told that he'd be okay. ''("[[Help Me Through the Night]]")'' Blake and the other residents were assigned to look into every possible diagnosis for [[Suzanne Britland]]. They gathered in Taryn's hospital room and went over every possible explanation for her symptoms. ''("[[Save the Last Dance for Me]]")'' During the blizzard, Blake helped Jackson treat several cases of frostbite in the emergency room. When Andrew came back to the hospital after walking to and from Seattle Pres to retrieve a liver for [[Elisa Tang]], he had frostbite in his fingers and Blake was tasked with preparing a bath of warm saline to warm his hands back up. ''("[[Snowblind]]")'' Blake worked on the case of [[Brad Spencer]], who had fallen onto train tracks and been electrocuted. When they determined Brad needed fasciotomies, Blake did one of his arms. ''("[[Life on Mars?]]")'' He has been raised by his grandmother since his parents died. ''("[[Help Me Through the Night]]")'' He is a [[General Surgery|surgical]] [[Resident|resident]] who works under [[Tom Koracick]]. *He appears with no dialogue in both [[I Know This Bar]] and [[Help Me Through the Night]], due to his facial injuries. *He thinks being liked is overrated.[[It's Raining Men]], x xBlakeSimms.png|[[Back in the Saddle]] xBlakeSimms.png|[[It's Raining Men]] xBlakeSimms.png|[[My Shot]] xBlakeSimms.png|[[Let's All Go to the Bar]] SxBlakeSimms.png|[[I Know This Bar]] xBlakeSimms.png|[[Help Me Through the Night]] xBlakeSimms.png|[[Save the Last Dance for Me]] xBlakeSimms.png|[[Snowblind]] xBlakeSimms.png|[[Life on Mars?]] x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg Sx-.jpg Sx-.jpg Sx-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg {{Blake Simms Appearances}} {{Scrollbox}} [[de:Blake Simms]] {{DEFAULTSORT:Simms, Blake}} [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:GA Characters]] [[Category:GA S Characters]] [[Category:S Characters]] [[Category:S S Characters]] [[Category:Doctors]] [[Category:Patients]] [[Category:Patients (ER)]] [[Category:Patients (Neuro)]] [[Category:Patients (Plastics)]] [[Category:Patients (Trauma)]]

'''Brad DiMarco''' is a patient who was seriously injured when a firework went off in his face.


Brad was at the Phoenix Fair with [[Tara Brown]], [[Mac]], [[Will]], and [[Bella]]. They were all doing mushrooms and decided to set off some fireworks. They were interrupted by the firefighters of station , who informed them that setting off fireworks in the park was illegal. However, Brad lit another one and it exploded directly in his face, seriously injuring him. All the friends panicked and Tara's ankle was injured in the ensuing chaos. All the friends begged the firefighters to save Brad and then Will, in a misguided attempt to help Brad, climbed into the fire engine and started to drive it out of the park. He drove it into the intersection, where it was t-boned by a delivery van and tipped on its side, trapping Will inside. While some firefighters worked to free Will, others worked on Brad, using a t-shirt to stem the bleeding from his face while they waited for an aid car to arrive. Tara frantically told them they had to save him because she loved him and he'd saved her life by dragging her out of the house after the pandemic, saying she needed to celebrate the fact that she'd lived when so many hadn't.

Because the accident will caused blocked the intersection and backed up traffic, the aid car was unable to get to the park, forcing them to walk the gurney to the park on foot and then walk Brad back to the hospital. Tara followed them despite having an injured ankle. ''("[[Phoenix from the Flame]]")''

At the hospital, Brad's injuries were assessed then he was taken into surgery, where [[Michelle Lin]] did the first of what she said would be multiple surgeries to fix his face. ''("[[Here Comes the Sun]]")''



He's friends with [[Tara Brown]], [[Mac]], [[Will]], and [[Bella]].

'''Brad Gailis''' is the father of Kevin Gailis.


Brad and his wife, [[Melissa Gailis|Melissa]], came to the hospital when their son, Kevin, was pushed into a table saw while he was at school. They were horrified to learn that the teacher, [[Dave Buckley]], was drunk at the time. Kevin was taken into surgery, where the saw blade was removed and his injuries were repaired. It looked like he might lose his arm because the blood flow had been compromised, but Maggie was ultimately able to save it and Kevin was stable and awake afterward. It was proven that Buckley hadn't been drinking and Buckley came to visit Kevin in his recovery room.



He is married to [[Melissa Gailis]].


He and his wife have a son, Kevin, who was injured when he was pushed into a table saw.

'''Brad Spencer''' is a man who was electrocuted after falling on the train tracks.


Brad and his girlfriend, Paula, were at the train station, kissing to celebrate the fact that Brad had decided to give up an internship at a studio in order to go to England with Paula, who had been awarded a Rhodes Scholarship. They didn't notice the train pulling away and Brad suddenly fell down onto the tracks, where he was electrocuted. He was taken to the hospital, where they noted that both arms and his left leg were severely burned. They did fasciotomies in the ER before taking him to surgery for that and his head injury. After his surgery, Paula was told he'd need more surgery and would have a long recovery. They warned him that whoever took care of him would need to spend a lot of time in hospitals as he recovered and she decided that she couldn't stay. She wondered what that said about her that she wouldn't stay after he'd decided to give up his dream for her.



He was dating [[Paula (Life on Mars?)|Paula]]. When she was awarded a Rhodes Scholarship, he decided to go with her to England, despite having been offered an internship at a studio for himself. After he was electrocuted, however, she decided she couldn't stay and take care of him when she was told he'd have a long recovery with more surgeries.


Paula called his family after his accident and said they were on their way.


*He was  at the time of his hospitalization.
*He plays guitar.
*He and Paula both graduated from University of Washington.

'''Brady Mays''' is the brother of [[Jonah Mays]].


At the age of six, Brady's brother, Jonah, was diagnosed with progressive kyphoscoliosis. Due to his condition, he had frequent surgeries. When rods were placed, they bent instead of straightening his spine. When their parents died when Jonah was twelve, his brother got custody of him and took over raising him. Six years later, Jonah was planning to go to college away from his brother and wanted to have a vertebral body tethering with the hope that it would allow him to live more normally and have less frequent surgeries. The surgery went well, but the tether didn't help. Instead of giving up, Amelia suggested a vertebral column resection, which involved replacing the deformed section of his spine with a mesh cage. That surgery went forward and went well. He woke up with no neurological deficits.



After their parents died, he started raising his brother, Jonah. He and his brother have a tradition before each of Jonah's surgeries that involves bowing to each other and shaking hands to say goodbye.


*He was captain of an Ultimate Frisbee team in law school.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Mays, Brady}}

'''Brian Williams''' is the best friend of [[Nick Marsh]].


Brian was at his daughter, Alex's, volleyball game when he had heart palpatations. He went to the hospital, where he was diagnosed with a pheochromocytoma on his adrenal gland. Because he'd previously donated a kidney to [[Nick Marsh]], he had only one adrenal gland, making his surgery extremely risky. Despite this complication, his surgery went well and he was stable afteward and his kidney was undamaged.



He is married to a woman named Paige.


He and his wife have three daughters. One daughter is trying to get a volleyball scholarship, one is in callbacks for the school play, and one just got dumped. In addition to that, he helped raise Nick's niece, Charlotte.


He and [[Nick Marsh]] have been friends since they were five. They played Little League together and after Nick's mom died, he practically lived with Brian's family.

'''Byron Gibbis''' is a patient who developed endocarditis due to an infection in his mouth.


Byron was taken to the hospital after being found unconscious on his front porch. He was febrile, tachycardic, and had a heart murmur. Winston ordered a cardiac CT and noted Osler's nodes on his hands. Byron woke up in the ER while they were examining him and tried to leave, saying he didn't want to get COVID and believed everyone in the hospital was sick. Maggie assured him he was safe and they'd get him whatever he needed to feel safe.

Osler's nodes indicated endocarditis, so while he had a cardiac CT, they theorized possible causes. Winston remembered him saying he hadn't left his house since lockdown started and asked Byron about his teeth. Byron said he'd used a paper clip to get a popcorn kernel out of his teeth. He had sore gums, but he refused to go to the dentist because of the pandemic. He had a dental infection which had caused the endocarditis. The CT showed an aortic valve abscess which was almost completely blocking the valves.

As they prepared Byron for his surgery, he started to freak out and left the OR. When they found him, he was huddled in a corner, nude. They managed to convince him to return to the OR and have his surgery, telling him he'd die without it. He was later said to be stable.



His best friend Rory was previously healthy, but died of COVID, increasing his anxiety.


*He was  at the time of his hospitalization.

'''CJ Madison''' is a baseball player who got a bat lodged in his chest.


CJ was playing baseball when a bat shattered and a piece of it became impaled in his chest. He was taken to the ER, where they ran a CT and then took him into surgery. The bat was easily removed, but due to the location of the injury, they knew that his dream of being called up to the majors wasn't going to be happening anytime soon.


He plays on a minor league baseball team. He was looking forward to being called up to the majors before he was injured.

When it was delayed a second time, Meredith announced that they had permission to extend the day until everyone had gotten their surgery and they'd be doing more days, one per month.



She was a strong advocate for her mother getting the surgery she needed to relieve her pain.

'''Carly Davis''' is Jo's therapist who came into the hospital with carbon monoxide poisoning.



While Jo was in residential treatment, Carly was one of her therapists. She did EMDR with Jo, who wasn't convinced it would be helpful. Despite this, Jo went through with the first session. That night, Jo tried to sneak out of the facility, but was stopped by Carly, who was waiting for her. She said the therapists rotate every night waiting for runners. Later, when Jo admitted in therapy that she was angry, she was also upset because she felt that it made her like Paul. Carly said she wasn't like Paul because she was able to feel the anger, but control her behavior. They then threw toys at the wall to release the anger.


Carly came into the Grey Sloan ER with carbon monoxide in what they believed to be an attempted suicide. She was taken to the hyperbaric chamber to treat her. The chamber worked and her CO level came down, but she was still unconscious. When she had a seizure, they thought she must be diabetic and her sugar had crashed. They gave her D and she regained consciousness. After her therapy was complete, she was moved to a room. Jo told her that she would have to call psych to report the suicide attempt. Carly corrected that it wasn't a suicide attempt. Her carbon monoxide detector had a dead battery she'd ignored and she was just curled up with a book and her heater and the next thing she knew, she was in the chamber. Jo then took herself off Carly's case, which Carly noted was her putting up a healthy boundary.


She is a psychiatrist at the Mercer Island Treatment Center. She also used to be an on-call social worker for Safe Haven.


*She was  years sober at the time of her carbon monoxide poisoning.
*She likes almonds and science fiction.
*She was  at the time of her poisoning.

'''Carol Dickinson''' is the mother of [[Betty Nelson]].


When their daughter, Britney, called them from rehab, Carol and her husband John came to Seattle to find her. When they learned she'd run away from rehab, they went over to the hospital, where they found Amelia. They were confused as to how Britney had met her in the first place and she explained that it was through Leo. They hadn't known she had given birth to a baby and asked to see him immediately. After meeting Leo, they decided they wanted to take him back to the hotel with them, but Owen said he was Leo's legal guardian and wouldn't allow it. ''("[[I Walk the Line]]")''

When they came back to the house to pick up Leo to take him home with them, Owen was paged to the hospital to deal with a mass overdose. Amelia stayed behind, but was later called in because Betty was among those brought in and had collapsed with chest pain. John and Carol waited in the waiting room with Owen and Amelia for news on Betty while she had heart surgery. When they were told Betty would be okay, they were excited. However, Carol wasn't sure how they'd tell Betty that Linus, her boyfriend, had died while she was in surgery. John didn't want to, but Amelia said she needed to know and hoped it would be Betty's bottom as Ryan had been for her. ''("[[I Want a New Drug]]")''

Two weeks later, when Betty had mostly healed from her surgery, they packed up Leo's things and left to take both of them home. However, later that night, they brought Leo back, as Betty had decided she wanted to get to be a kid and she couldn't do that if she had to be Leo's mom. She decided to give Leo to Owen and Amelia. ''("[[We Didn't Start the Fire]]")''



She is married to [[John Dickinson]].


Carol's daughter, Britney (aka Betty), ran away from home after becoming addicted to drugs following a soccer injury. She had a baby by her drug dealer and he was placed in foster care after he was born. After running away from rehab and nearly dying when drugs she'd taken damaged her heart, they went to take her and Leo back home with them, but Britney decided she wanted Leo to stay with Owen and Amelia because she wanted to be able to be a kid.

'''Former'''
US Air Force |first appearance = '''[[Grey's Anatomy|GA]]:''' [[Ain't That a Kick in the Head]] |last appearance = '''[[Grey's Anatomy|GA]]:''' [[Help Me Through the Night]] |only appearance = '''[[Station |S]]:''' [[I Know This Bar]] |count = |seasons = *'''[[Grey's Anatomy|GA]]:''' [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]], [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]], and [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]] *'''[[Station |S]]:''' [[Season (Station )|]] *'''[[Grey's Anatomy: B-Team]]''' |portrayed by = [[Alex Blue Davis]] }} '''Casey Parker''' is a surgical resident at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]]. Casey came into [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]] for an interview to be considered for an internship. He explained that he'd served two tours of duty in cybersecurity for the Air Force and after seeing the surgeons work while he was injured, he decided to quit the military to go into medicine. ''("[[Ain't That a Kick in the Head]]")'' Casey attended the new intern mixer at the hospital, where Richard gave a speech about them starting their work as doctors. During the party, Meredith Grey was celebrated as she learned she had been nominated for a [[Catherine Fox Award|Harper Avery Award]]. The new interns then walked around the hospital, in awe that they worked there and so did Meredith Grey. ''("[[Come on Down to My Boat, Baby]]")'' While the hospital was dealing with the injuries caused by a roller coaster derailing at a fair, Casey tended to patients in the clinic. He came to get Amelia for a consult on a patient with a head injury. ''("[[Who Lives, Who Dies, Who Tells Your Story]]")'' When the hospital was hacked, Casey had the idea to use a defibrillator to override the circuit in the blood bank keypad, restoring access to blood. When Bailey learned about this, she asked what else Casey could do to help, remembering his background in cybersecurity. Casey then revealed that he had a criminal history of hacking and as a condition of that, he wasn't allowed to manipulate computer systems anymore, or allow or enable anyone else to. She pushed him and he gave her written directions to tell the FBI to gain access. When she learned that the FBI was more interested in finding the hacker than saving the hospital, she called Casey to her office, giving him access to her laptop and login and promising no one would ever know. He was able to gain access to the hospital's systems and restore normal function. He then confessed to Bailey that he had been arrested for hacking the DMV to change his sex on his license from female to male because the place where he lived wouldn't allow him to do that otherwise. ''("[[---]]")'' Casey worked with Owen developing his proposal for his entry into the surgical contest. When Casey learned that acquiring the patent for a needed polymer was prohibitively expensive, Owen decided he didn't need the contest and didn't enter. ''("[[Harder, Better, Faster, Stronger]]")'' When [[Kimmie Park]] struggled to eat and keep food down during chemotherapy, Casey supported the idea of her using medical marijuana to help her nausea, which worked. ''("[[Games People Play]]")'' The time came for the interns to go through their Trauma Certification Drill. Owen set the scenario where a Cessna crashed into a Greyhound bus. April interrupted and said that the evacuation helicopter wasn't coming and people were dying. Their job was to save lives. Owen judged the competition, but April hung around to help and insistently made the scenarios worse. She even had a second plane crash hit Andrew, who was helping monitor. She also added rain with a hose. The difficulties ended when April was paged away. Owen helped the interns calm down and continued the drill. When April returned, she learned that Casey had been the one to page her away. He realized that she was endangering the patients the most, so he removed her from the equation. She told him he was trying to cheat and after she "cheated" at her certification, a man came into the hospital and died because she couldn't save him. She then started crying and performing CPR on a dummy while the interns watched. Andrew stopped her and she said the certification was done. ''("[[Caught Somewhere in Time]]")'' After several of the doctors ingested weed cookies, Meredith told the interns they'd have to step up more and told them to keep track of what they did and whoever did the most would win a contest and get to scrub in with her on a Whipple. ''("[[Judgment Day]]")'' After April was in a car accident and came to the hospital hypothermic, Casey and the other interns took shifts with the attendings doing CPR. ''("[[Cold as Ice]]")'' On the day of Alex and Jo's wedding, Casey was part of the group that went to the wrong wedding. When they realized what had happened, they all rushed to get on a ferry out to Bainbridge Island. Despite a series of delays, Jo and Alex eventually got married on the ferry, witnessed by their friends. ''("[[All of Me]]")'' When Teddy had a sudden pain in her leg, she found Casey at the desk and asked him the name of the head of cardio. He told her and got her into a room before getting Maggie to come see her. He also checked on [[Cece Colvin]] for her so she could treat Teddy. ''("[[With a Wonder and a Wild Desire]]")'' He worked on the case of [[Cece Colvin]], a matchmaker awaiting a heart and kidney transplant. He had to show her pictures of his girlfriend to get her to stop trying to match him up. ''("[[Everyday Angel]]")'' Casey worked on Ned Billings with Webber. He was also there when Ned coded and Richard was unable to resuscitate. When Bailey stepped in to try to reperfuse Ned's liver to preserve it for [[Roberta Gibbs]], he initially asked if he should go get someone. Jo said to get Alex, but Bailey said to get a reperfusion machine instead so they could save the liver. ''("[[Flowers Grow Out of My Grave]]")'' Casey worked on [[Natasha Deon]], who had fallen from a hotel balcony and broken her pelvis. ''("[[Help, I'm Alive]]")'' When Catherine had surgery to remove her tumor, Casey was in the crowd watching from the gallery until Richard closed the gallery. ''("[[The Winner Takes It All]]")'' Casey worked on the case of [[Colin Anderson]], who was shot during a parade. ''("[[I Walk the Line]]")'' Casey treated patients in the ER during the mass opioid overdose. ''("[[I Want a New Drug]]")'' Jackson was treating Rick, who had been burned over a large portion of his body. He decided to use fish skin to graft the burns and had the interns skin the fish. When Richard learned the rest of the fish was being put in medical waste, he decided to host a fish fry and invited the interns. ''("[[And Dream of Sheep]]")'' When Jo received her DNA results, which included the name of a possible first cousin, she asked Casey about finding other relatives, including her birth mother. She said she didn't want to, but later came and asked if he could do it. He revealed that he already had and showed her the name of her birth mother. ''("[[And Dream of Sheep]]")'' After finding Teddy in the blue light room having pain, Casey was sent to page OB and Owen. After that was squared away, he was asked to read math problems out so Dahlia could try to do them faster than [[Nora Hillridge]]. ''("[[Add It Up]]")'' Casey assisted on the case of [[Bertram Hollister]], who was having a heart procedure. ''("[[Reunited]]")'' When an article came out that condemned the healthcare industry, stemming from a list of possible article topics Meredith floated to a publisher, the residents discussed it in the locker room while getting ready for their days. Taryn liked the article and said Meredith was a badass for writing it, but Blake warned them that while he had Hopkins and Koracick on his resum\ue, they might have difficulty finding other jobs. ''("[[It's Raining Men]]")'' On the day of Meredith's hearing, Casey and the other residents were told they'd have to up their game to make up for the missing attendings. At the end of the day, the residents were all exhausted from the extra work they'd done. Blake then announced that Levi had been the one to turn Meredith's fraud in, turning the other residents against him. ''("[[My Shot]]")'' On Meredith's first day back at work, Casey and the other residents greeted her with a cake. Afterward, they went on rounds, where they worked on the case of [[Jamie Caldwell]], which Casey followed to its end. ''("[[Let's All Go to the Bar]]")'' While Casey was at the bar with some other residents, a car crashed through a window and into the bar. ''("[[Let's All Go to the Bar]]")'' Immediately after the crash, Casey was confused, thinking there'd been a bombing, and asked if they were in the Green Zone. When his confusion persisted, Jackson examined him, but said his pupils were equal and reactive, though he had a small hematoma on his head. He told Casey to lie down until help got there. A while afterward, the firefighters finally got a door unblocked and since Casey was able to walk, Nico helped lead him out so they could get to the hospital. ''("[[I Know This Bar]]")'' Casey was taken from the bar to the hospital, where he was still very confused and continued to ask if there'd been a bombing. He got a CT, which showed a temporal lobe contusion, which was exacerbating his PTSD. However, before they could move him to the NeuroICU, he left the room and hid in the hospital. Amelia and Teddy searched the hospital for him and found him in the hyperbaric chamber. Later, he was stable enough to visit Taryn in her room. ''("[[Help Me Through the Night]]")'' He has a girlfriend, but nothing is known about her. ''("[[Everyday Angel]]")'' He was a member of the Air Force, but quit to go into medicine. He is now a surgical resident at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]]. *As a kid, he watched a lot of MASH and had a thing for Hawkeye Pierce.[[Ain't That a Kick in the Head]], x *Casey is the first '''Cece Colvin''' was a patient who crashed her car after passing out behind the wheel.


Cece was driving when she lost consciousness and ran into [[Nisha]] and then hit a pole. She was taken to the ER, where she was only worried about Nisha and repeatedly claimed that she was fine. She'd had two previous heart transplants and said even if she died, she'd have far outlived what she should have. Her EKG was negative, so they ran more tests to figure out why she had passed out. The tests showed that her anti-rejection meds had caused her kidneys to fail and she'd need peritoneal dialysis until she could get a new kidney. She was taken in for a procedure to allow that. ''("[[With a Wonder and a Wild Desire]]")''

That night, Cece crashed, but was able to be resuscitated. They put her on amiodarone to improve her heart function and ran more tests. Her heart was barely pumping blood, so she had a heart biopsy, which showed congestive heart failure. They placed an internal defibrillator and she was put on the transplant list for a third time. When she learned that Nisha had died, she felt guilty and said she didn't want a new heart because she didn't want to live. Meredith talked to her and said she deserved to live and Nisha would want her to get a new heart. Also, Meredith wanted Cece to find her new love. ''("[[Broken Together]]")''

On her eighth day of dialysis, Cece developed an infection in her peritoneum, meaning they couldn't use that for dialysis anymore. Since her other access sites were closed from prior surgeries, they searched for another way to get access. Meredith finally figured out they could due a translunar catheter and do dialysis through her back. ''("[[Gut Feeling]]")''

While she continued to wait, she furthered her matchmaking tendencies by trying to get up [[Casey Parker]] until he told her he already had a girlfriend, and talking to Maggie about her relationship with Jackson and her feelings about him suddenly leaving town. At the end of the day, she got Maggie to admit that she was upset about what Jackson had done and was too focused on other people to answer her own questions. ''("[[Everyday Angel]]")''

Cece's condition continued to decline and she developed pleural effusions. She was taken for pleurocentesis, which relieved some of the pressure. During the wind storm, organs became available for Cece when [[Phoebe Moss]] was declared brain dead. She decided to go forward with the transplant despite the significant risks. ''("[[Blowin' in the Wind]]")''

Cece was taken to the OR for surgery, but the power was knocked out by the wind storm, trapping Phoebe in the elevator. Cece realized something had gone wrong and her surgery was delayed because of it. When they finally got Phoebe out of the elevator, the transplant went forward as planned. Her heart was transplanted easily, but during her kidney transplant, she coded and was unable to be resuscitated. ''("[[Shelter from the Storm]]")''


After Andrew confessed his love to Meredith, she had a dream, which included Cece not feeling that Meredith kept her promise to find and accept love. ''("[[Drawn to the Blood]]")''



She said that she spent  years falling in love with straight women. ''("[[Broken Together]]")''


After hitting [[Nisha]] with her car, Cece refused to leave her side, wanting her to have someone to be with while she waited for her parents. She also promised to find Nisha love after she was recovered. When Nisha died, she was distraught and blamed herself.


After Meredith hired Cece to find her love, Cece started asking Meredith questions about her life, which Meredith found frustrating and time-consuming. When Cece realized it wasn't working, she went another route and told Meredith to go buy herself five new outfits. ''("[[Gut Feeling]]")''


She was a matchmaker who boasted an % success rate.

'''Chad Anderson''' is a patient who believed COVID- was fake.


Chad was out jogging when he collapsed. he was taken to the hospital, where he was short of breath. He was convinced it was just an expired inhaler to blame and asked for a new prescription. Bailey had him moved to an isolated room and ordered tests, including a COVID swab. He said that wasn't necessary as he knew COVID was fake. Bailey later reported to him that his COVID test had come back positive. A chest x-ray had shown ground glass opacities in his lungs, which is why he was short of breath. He also had a clot in his leg and what dermatologists were calling COVID toe, a rash specific to COVID patients. Chad still believed it was fake and refused to accept her diagnoses, saying runners don't get blood clots. He refused her prescribed treatment and signed himself out of the hospital against medical advice. Before he could get far, he collapsed outside the hospital. Teddy, Mabel, and Bailey attempted resuscitation, but Chad died despite their best efforts.

'''Charlie''' is a man who repeatedly overdosed.


Charlie was driving and doing drugs. He ended up passed out with his foot depressing the brake. He was discovered when the aid car from  drove by with another patient. They stopped and Travis stayed behind to treat him. He was unable to rouse Charlie by banging on the windows, so he broke one of the windows and climbed in. When he still wasn't able to rouse Charlie, he administered naloxone, which woke Charlie up and caused him to lift his foot off the brake, allowing the car to roll forward onto Theo Ruiz's foot. When Charlie heard the screaming, he pressed the brake, causing the car to stop on top of Theo's foot. After a moment, he learned what he'd done and freed Theo's foot. He was then loaded in to the aid car from station  and taken to the hospital. ''("[[Make No Mistake, He's Mine]]")''

Three days later, Charlie overdosed again. Travis and Vic revived him with naloxone in his apartment and then took him to the hospital, where they learned it was his third overdose within a month. His friend, [[Libby]], said he was about to quit drugs and go to rehab. After Charlie was taken to the hospital, Libby herself overdosed. They revived her and took her to the hospital, but she quickly left, overdosed again, and died in the park, slumped against a tree. Charlie was heartbroken when he checked himself out of the hospital and learned that Libby had died. He got and used drugs himself, but didn't overdose. Travis and Vic took him to the hospital again. On the way, he talked to Libby over the broken phone and told her he needed to stop using drugs. ''("[[No One is Alone]]")''



He and [[Libby]] were friends from seventh grade until she died. ''("[[No One is Alone]]")''


*He lived at  East Yesler Way.

'''Charlotte Marsh''' is the niece of [[Nick Marsh]], who raised her.


Charlotte came to her uncle's cabin with her boyfriend, [[Silver]], and found her uncle on the couch making out with [[Meredith Grey]]. They all had a meal together and Silver revealed that they were planning to go to Costa Rica in two weeks. Charlotte then had to tell Nick she was leaving school. This upset Nick, who was insistent that Charlotte finish school. They argued over it.

Charlotte went to Meredith and asked her to talk to Nick. Meredith said that Charlotte reminded her of herself, only braver. Charlotte insisted she wasn't rebelling. She just wanted some change. and to figure out how she wanted to live her life. Meredith encouraged Charlotte to talk to Nick herself.

Nick tried to persuade Charlotte to stay in school so she wouldn't end up like her mother. Charlotte said that she wasn't her mother and she just needed to figure some things out. Charlotte reminded him of how responsible she already was because of how good a job he'd done raising her. She promised him she'd go back to school, but she needed to go on this trip first.

At the end of the night, Charlotte and Silver left after Charlotte promised to come back the next weekend and give Nick all the information about her trip so he'd know where she was.



She is dating [[Silver]]. They met in the woods when Charlotte was participating in one of his micro-dosing sessions and said they felt like they had known each other for lifetimes.


She was raised by her uncle, [[Nick Marsh]], after her mother left her.

'''Cheryl Giles''' is a woman who was in a motorcycle accident.


Cheryl and her husband, Doug, came into the ER after they crashed Doug's new motorcycle. They had just gone for a ride around the block and Doug swerved to avoid hitting a dog. Their daughter, Wynnie, drove them to the hospital in their van with only a learner's permit. In the ER, they learned that while Cheryl had only cuts and bruises on her hand, Doug had a serious head injury because Cheryl had been wearing the only helmet. She said she didn't even like the motorcycle, but she liked seeing Doug in the garage with it and it stirred up feelings. While her hands were bandaged, Doug was taken into surgery to treat a brain bleed. After his surgery, he was expected to recover fully and said he'd be getting rid of the motorcycle.



She is married to [[Doug Giles]].


She and Doug have two children: Wynnie and Hank. Wynnie was upset when they became injured and didn't trust them to make good decisions anymore.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Giles, Cheryl}}

'''Chet''' is a patient who got burned on the hot sidewalk during the heat wave.


Chet's friend, [[Truman]], dared him to fry an egg on the sidewalk during the heat wave. Chet did so, but fell and burned his butt and upper thighs. He was taken to the hospital, where his burns were debrided.



He and [[Truman]] are friends.


*He and Truman have a web channel NakedBroStuff.

'''Chris Duran''' is a member of the rugby team who came to the ER after a fight.


Chris came into the ER after a fight. His tibia was broken, so it was wrapped in the ER. While he waited, he and a couple teammates got in a fight, during which he tried to stand on his broken leg. His leg started swelling and became painful, so Owen examined him and found compartment syndrome, so he did a fasciotomy in the ER to relieve the pressure and then took Chris into surgery.

Chris was about to be put under for surgery and Owen explained that he caught the compartment syndrome in time for him not to lose the leg, but now they needed to stop the bleeding that caused it. Chris started panicking and rambled about things he hadn't said or done, thinking he was going to die. Owen told Chris to shut up so he could keep saving him and he was put under.



He has a girlfriend.


Before his surgery, he worried about not having told his parents they were good parents.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Duran, Chris}}

'''Claire Conway''' is a woman who developed toxic megacolon after taking leftover antibiotics.


Claire came into the ER after collapsing in a convenience store. She told the doctors that she had had flu symptoms, so she took some antibiotics she had leftover, because she didn't have time to see a doctor due to having custody of her two nephews. The doctors ordered a CT, which showed toxic megacolon, which resulted from the antibiotics killing off the good bacteria. They took her to the OR, where she told them she didn't want to die because her nephews had already lost their mom. When she had sudden extreme pain in her abdomen from her colon rupturing, they quickly sedated her and Andrew operated to remove a portion of her colon. When she woke up, she was stable and talked to her nephews, saying she knew what happened was scary for them and giving them money to go get pizza to eat.



She got custody of her two nephews, [[Gabe]] and [[Eli]], when her sister died, two years ago. She says she loves them, but they take a lot of work. Before she got custody of the kids, her mother always told her she looked forward to the day Claire had kids so they could be as awful to her as she was to her mother.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Conway, Claire}}

|portrayed by = [[Chris Aquilino]]
}}

'''Clark''' is the boyfriend of [[Ivan]].


Clark's boyfriend, Ivan, was feeding his Burmese python, Gigi, when she bit his arm instead of her food. Then she wrapped her body around his and began constricting. Clark put him in the back of the car and drove him to the hospital. Once they arrived, several doctors came out to assess Ivan. Ivan kept insisting that it looked worse than it was and that Gigi hadn't meant any harm. When Animal Control was delayed, Winston had the idea to spray Gigi with alcohol, which would irritate her eyes and get her to release her jaw so they could free him. Bailey did that and then Winston, Jordan, and Link unwrapped Gigi from Ivan's body. Then they got him onto a gurney and took him inside.

In the ER, he had reduced oxygen and a chest x-ray showed opacity in his chest. Richard believed it was a hemothorax and wanted to insert a chest tube, but Bailey said no and insisted on a CT, which showed that Ivan actually had a diaphragmatic rupture and the opacity was his abdominal organs, which had been compressed into his chest cavity. They took him into surgery, where they moved his organs back into his abdomen. When he started coding and went into DIC, they were forced to stop the surgery, pack him, and move him to the ICU.

On the way to the ICU, he coded again, and Bailey did chest compressions until they got him into his room, where they defibrillated. They were able to stabilize him enough that Clark was able to sit with him. The hope was that they could continue his surgery the next day. While Ivan was in surgery, Clark made the decision to have Gigi sent to an animal rescue.



He is dating [[Ivan]]. When Ivan was bitten by his pet python, Clark struggled with loving someone who had such a blindspot for the harm such a large animal could do.

{{DISPLAYTITLE:Clark}}

'''Clervie Martin''' is a girl who had surgery on her skull to re-shape it.


Clervie was born with craniosynostosis, which caused her skull to fuse prematurely. Her pediatrician told her parents it was a mild case and would resolve on its own, but by the time she was three, it hadn't and she had an abnormally-shaped skull. Tom found her case and offered the parents a pro bono surgery in exchange for being allowed to film the surgery and their family before and after. Having no other way to afford the surgery, they agreed, though it made them visibly uncomfortable.

Noticing their discomfort and wanting to ease it, Jackson went to the parents and gave them the option to decline the cameras access, promising that they wouldn't have to pay for Clervie's surgery either way. They chose to proceed without the cameras. Clervie's surgery went well and her parents sat by her bed in the PICU afterward.


*She was three years old at the time of her surgery.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Martin, Clervie}}

'''Clifford Ndugu''' is the father of [[Winston Ndugu]].



When his wife was diagnosed with cancer, he started drinking more and ended up in jail multiple times. His wife then used the money that was meant to be for her treatment to bail him out on more than one occasion, which created a rift between him and his son, Winston. ''("[[Road Trippin']]")''


Years later, Clifford and Winston were still estranged. Clifford doesn't think well of Winston, reminding his mother and Maggie that he almost failed sixth grade. Winston defended that he did that because he was busy helping his mother while Clifford gambled away all their money. When he joined the Zoom call on his mother's birthday, he told Winston they should try to keep the peace. Winston said he was right and then quickly left the call. ''("[[You'll Never Walk Alone]]")''



He is estranged from his son, Winston, but is close with his mother and his other son, Wendell.


*He has a problem with gambling.
*He also has a drinking problem, which led to him being jailed more than once.<ref>[[Road Trippin']], x</ref>

'''Clive Johnson''' is a man [[Maggie Pierce|Maggie]] met on Tinder.



Clive and Maggie matched on Tinder and set a date. However, after a long day at work, Maggie forgot about the date and was surprised when Clive arrived to pick her up. Despite this, she declined a rain check and they went out on the date as scheduled. ''("[[---]]")''


Maggie continued to see Clive. During a subsequent date, she received a text message, reminding her that she was missing dance class with Richard. She apologized to Clive, saying that it wasn't that she didn't want to see him, but she did have to leave. ''("[[Harder, Better, Faster, Stronger]]")''


Maggie decided to host a game night when Meredith and Amelia asked to meet Clive. They played some games and had fun, but the night was ended when Clive's wife showed up. Jackson said they needed to work it out somewhere else and showed them both out the door, telling Clive to forget Maggie's address\uaand to never call her again. ''("[[Games People Play]]")''



[[Maggie Pierce]]
He went on a date with [[Maggie Pierce]]. ''("[[---]]")''

After the first date, they continued to see each other. ''("[[Harder, Better, Faster, Stronger]]")''

They continued to date until his wife showed up at game night, after which Jackson told him to leave and to not call Maggie again, effectively ending the relationship. ''("[[Games People Play]]")''

[[Daphne Johnson]]
He's married to Daphne, but cheated on her with Maggie, which she implied wasn't the first time. She tracked his phone and confronted him at Maggie's game night. ''("[[Games People Play]]")''


He is a stock broker. Because of this, he doesn't understand when Maggie talks about medicine. ''("[[Harder, Better, Faster, Stronger]]")''

'''Cora''' was a patient who had a pancreatic head tumor.


As a child, Cora was typically cared for by her aunt, because her mother was usually too busy with her newest boyfriend to make sure Cora was eating, bathing, and otherwise healthy. Sally often lied to Cora, telling her her mother had just called and said that she loved her.

As an adult, Cora became Sally's caregiver when she developed dementia. When it had progressed to the point where Sally no longer recognized her, Cora ended up in the hospital with a -centimeter pancreatic head tumor. Nick consulted with Meredith about the tumor and she said a traditional Whipple was unlikely to work. Instead, they developed a plan that involved removing all the involved organs, dissecting out the tumor, and then replacing the organs. They talked to Cora about it and she decided to have the surgery despite the risks as she feared leaving her aunt without a caregiver.

They took her into surgery, where the surgery went well until they went to re-attach her organs. There was unexpected bleeding and as they had no blood available to transfuse given the nationwide blood shortage, they decided to stop the surgery until more blood arrived to avoid additional blood loss. ''("[[Out for Blood]])''

When Meredith learned that the incoming blood had been destroyed in an accident, she suggested moving Cora to the ICU to keep her alive until they had more blood and could finish her surgery. However, she later coded in the ICU and they were unable to resuscitate her. ''("[[You Are the Blood]]")''



She was raised by her aunt, [[Sally (Season )|Sally]], when her mom couldn't take care of her.


*She was  at the time of her death.<ref>[[Out for Blood]], x</ref>
*She was pronounced dead at :.<ref>[[You Are the Blood]], x</ref>

'''Cynthia Cole''' is Andrew's psychiatrist.


Cynthia started seeing Andrew after he risked his his life going out in a blizzard to retrieve a liver. Bailey ordered him to see a psychiatrist and said he wasn't allowed to treat any patients until she cleared him. During his first session, he denied any symptoms of mania and said his actions saved lives and that's why he did what he did. ''("[[Life on Mars?]]")''

When Andrew had a major depressive episode after Richard's surgery, Carina and his other loved ones arranged with Dr. Cole to convince him to accept treatment. After he broke down crying, saying he didn't want to feel like this anymore, Carina told him the way to do that was to listen to the people who knew what to do, including Cole. One of the things she taught him was the importance of getting enough sleep to maintaining his mental health. ''("[[All Tomorrow's Parties]]")''


She is an [[Attending|attending]] [[Psychiatry|psychiatrist]] at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]].

'''D. Kennedy''' is a [[paramedic]] in [[Seattle]].



During the early COVID pandemic, D. transported a hallucinating [[Tom Koracick]] from his home to [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]]. ''("[[Fight the Power]]")''


She and her partner transported [[Karissa Skolaski]] to Grey Sloan after she and her husband were freed from their car. Jo took the case. ''("[[Sorry Doesn't Always Make It Right]]")''


After the Black Lives Matter protests started in Seattle, she responded to a call involving [[Guy Houston]]. He was hit in the chest with a rubber bullet during the protest. She and her colleague defibrillated Guy in the field and transported him to Grey Sloan, where they were met by Owen and Maggie. ''("[[Sign O' the Times]]")''


She later brought in [[Danny Young]], who was injured in a car accident with his father. She reported on his injuries and then took him inside. ''("[[Some Kind of Tomorrow]]")''


She is a paramedic working in [[Seattle]]. One of the hospital her route services is [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]].


*In [[Sorry Doesn't Always Make It Right]], she is shown wearing a firefighter uniform. While Seattle firefighters are also trained EMTs, her uniform worn in her other appearances indicate she is a regular paramedic rather than a firefighter.

{{Intern and Resident Infobox |name = Dahlia Qadri |image = x-.jpg |status = Alive |title = M.D. |job = [[General Surgery|Surgical]] [[Resident]] |workplace = '''Former'''
[[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]] |first appearance = [[Ain't That a Kick in the Head]] |last appearance = [[Reunited]] |count = |seasons = *'''[[Grey's Anatomy|GA]]:''' [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]], [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]], and [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]] *'''[[Grey's Anatomy: B-Team]]''' |portrayed by = [[Sophia Taylor Ali]] }} '''Dahlia Qadri''' was a surgical resident at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]] until she was fired. Dahlia came into [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]] for an interview to be considered for an internship. She believes patient connection is as important as surgical dexterity. She likes to bond with patients over an anecdote. ''("[[Ain't That a Kick in the Head]]")'' Dahlia attended the new intern mixer at the hospital, where Richard gave a speech about them starting their work as doctors. During the party, Meredith Grey was celebrated as she learned she had been nominated for a [[Catherine Fox Award|Harper Avery Award]]. The new interns then walked around the hospital, in awe that they worked there and so did Meredith Grey. ''("[[Come on Down to My Boat, Baby]]")'' When the hospital was hacked, the doctors had to resort to using old school methods to diagnose and treat patients. ''("[[Out of Nowhere]]")'' Dahlia worked with Jackson developing his proposal for the surgical contest. When Catherine approached her about another project she wanted Jackson to work on, Dahlia wrote both proposals and told Jackson she liked the other one. She wrote both proposals in under days total, which meant that in order to accomplish this, she didn't sleep at all during that time. ''("[[Harder, Better, Faster, Stronger]]")'' When [[Tyler Richardson]] was brought in with a chunk of metal in his leg, Dahlia was charged with escorting him to the CT. On the way, he woke up and pulled the metal of his leg, causing profuse bleeding. Thinking quickly, Dahlia pulled off her hijab and used it to slow the bleeding, saving Tyler's life. Later, while scrubbing in for the OR, Owen was suprised that she had removed her hijab and she replied that her hijab is "a symbol of [her] faith, but [her] faith is about service and compassion." She scrubbed in on the surgery, which Tyler survived. Later, Owen returned her hijab to her, after having it washed. ''("[[You Really Got a Hold on Me]]")'' The time came for the interns to go through their Trauma Certification Drill. Owen set the scenario where a Cessna crashed into a Greyhound bus. April interrupted and said that the evacuation helicopter wasn't coming and people were dying. Their job was to save lives. Owen judged the competition, but April hung around to help and insistently made the scenarios worse. She even had a second plane crash hit Andrew, who was helping monitor. She also added rain with a hose. The difficulties ended when April was paged away. Owen helped the interns calm down and continued the drill. When April returned, she learned that Casey had been the one to page her away. He realized that she was endangering the patients the most, so he removed her from the equation. She told him he was trying to cheat and after she "cheated" at her certification, a man came into the hospital and died because she couldn't save him. She then started crying and performing CPR on a dummy while the interns watched. Andrew stopped her and she said the certification was done. ''("[[Caught Somewhere in Time]]")'' After several of the doctors ingested weed cookies, Meredith told the interns they'd have to step up more and told them to keep track of what they did and whoever did the most would win a contest and get to scrub in with her on a Whipple. ''("[[Judgment Day]]")'' After April was in a car accident and came to the hospital hypothermic, Dahlia and the other interns took shifts with the attendings doing CPR. ''("[[Cold as Ice]]")'' On the day of Alex and Jo's wedding, Dahlia was part of the group that went to the wrong wedding. When they realized what had happened, they all rushed to get on a ferry out to Bainbridge Island. Despite a series of delays, Jo and Alex eventually got married on the ferry, witnessed by their friends. ''("[[All of Me]]")'' Dahlia helped treat [[Cheryl Giles]] after she and her husband crashed a motorcycle. After the dog they served to avoid hitting got loose in the ER, Dahlia was sent to chase it down. She caught it, but when Cheryl said they couldn't keep the dog, her son let it loose again. Dahlia chased the dog down again, but couldn't catch it. However, when she gave up and sat down, the dog jumped up next to her. She ended up taking the dog home. ''("[[Broken Together]]")'' Julius came into the hospital with trouble breathing after an apartment fire. They did an x-ray, which showed a pulmonary bleb. He'd had it since he was a child and didn't want it removed because he couldn't afford the surgery. Because he had so much difficulty breathing, Alex didn't want to let him leave without having the bleb removed and nicked Julius with a scalpel to make an excuse to take him into surgery. Dahlia saw what he did and said she'd have to report him. She did, but when Julius woke up, he was relieved that it was gone and knew his mother would be happy as well. ''("[[Momma Knows Best]]")'' During the wind storm, Dahlia helped treat [[Georgia]], who was impaled with shards of glass. She also scrubbed in on her surgery. ''("[[Blowin' in the Wind]]")'' After the power came back, Cece was waiting in the OR for her transplant. Dahlia monitored her and was sent to find out how much time it would be before the organs were ready and found that the procurement hadn't started yet. After the transplant started, Dahlia assisted. Cece ultimately died during the surgery. ''("[[Shelter from the Storm]]")'' Dahlia was on Meredith's service and helped develop a treatment plan for her patients. ''("[[I Walk the Line]]")'' When a flood of patients came into the ER with opioid overdoses, Dahlia treated a patient with a shooter's abscess and got a lesson in schooling her facial features. Later, when [[Ralph Tennyson]] came into the ER with lesions all over his feet, Dahlia debrided them and bandaged them. ''("[[I Want a New Drug]]")'' Jackson was treating Rick, who had been burned over a large portion of his body. He decided to use fish skin to graft the burns and had the interns skin the fish. When Richard learned the rest of the fish was being put in medical waste, he decided to host a fish fry and invited the interns. ''("[[And Dream of Sheep]]")'' After being beat to the answer of a math problem with an year old, Dahlia had Casey and then the other interns, plus Maggie and Bailey, come in and have a contest to see who could do the math the fastest on a series of problems. ''("[[Add It Up]]")'' When [[Abby Redding]] came into the ER after being attacked and assaulted, Dahlia was on the case. She helped examine Abby and collect evidence after she agreed. When Abby needed surgery, Dahlia helped coordinate all the women of the hospital coming together to line the halls so she wouldn't have to see the faces of any men. ''("[[Silent All These Years]]")'' Dahlia was working in the ER on [[Avi Styron]], who was in abdominal pain and waiting for a CT when [[Gemma Larson]] came in when a shoe impaled in her chest. Avi agreed that Dahlia should tend to her first. ''("[[Head Over High Heels]]")'' Thirteen days after Kari's stem cell transfusion, Dahlia was charged with monitoring her and tracking her progress. ''("[[Drawn to the Blood]]")'' When Kari's finger twitched, Dahlia helped monitor her to see if it would happen again. When she squeezed Toby's hand unconsciously, Dahlia said she'd seen it. She was also there to celebrate when Kari moved her hand again, more purposefully. ''("[[Jump Into the Fog]]")'' Dahlia worked on the case of [[Jai Prishna]], who had fallen off a cliff and hung there for hours. She was present when he finally woke up after falling into a coma following a stroke. ''("[[Nothing Left to Cling To]]")'' Wanting to find her joy again, Bailey set up a skills lab based around the case of [[Wade Foltz]]. She challenged the residents to determine his diagnosis and then practice their surgical skills for the chance to do a portion of the surgery. Dahlia incorrectly answered Bailey's question about the hardest part of the axillary-bifemoral bypass procedure, earning her a week of rectal exam assignments. Dahlia participated in the lab, but lost the skills challenge to Taryn. ''("[[Back in the Saddle]]")'' Dahlia worked with Jo on the case of [[Shirley Gregory]], who had been a patient of Meredith's. When Shirley refused to let anyone other than Meredith work on her, Jo had the idea to have Meredith video conference in to assist. After the surgery, Dahlia cried in the hallway. When Bailey found her, Dahlia explained that she had come to Grey Sloan to learn from Meredith and knew many other residents had as well. She was upset that Bailey had just fired her. Bailey then said she could have something in common with Meredith and said Dahlia was fired as well. ''("[[Reunited]]")'' She found a job in Michigan. ''("[[It's Raining Men]]")'' She has a crush on [[Jackson Avery]]. She thinks he is talented and attractive. ''("[[Harder, Better, Faster, Stronger]]")'' She was a [[General Surgery|surgical]] [[Resident|resident]] at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]] until she was fired after telling Bailey that she came to the hospital, as did many other residents, to learn from Meredith Grey. She re-matched to a hospital in Michigan. *She is the first prominent character to wear a hijab on the show. The first time hijabs were worn on the show was by extras in [[Be Still, My Soul]]. *She has very neat handwriting.[[Grey's Anatomy: B-Team]] *She was ranked third in her class.[[Broken Together]], x *She grew up in Utah.[[Add It Up]], x *She was bullied because she was the only non-Mormon in her school.[[Add It Up]], x *She took two years of Integral and Differential Calc.[[Add It Up]], x '''Dana Hamilton''' is [[Tom Koracick|Tom]]'s ex-wife.



Dana's first son, David, died at the age of ten when he was hit in the head with a baseball bat. This loss broke up her marriage and she and Tom divorced.


Later, Dana remarried and had another son, whom she named Guthrie. Guthrie bore a strong resemblance to David. When he was ten, he collapsed during a pastry class and was diagnosed with a brain tumor which had spread to his spine. Desperate her to help her son, she took him to Grey Sloan Memorial to see her ex-husband, Tom, in the hopes he could save Guthrie. Tom initially said he couldn't do the surgery because she was basically family and hospital policy prohibited it, but after Amelia was forced to step away mid-surgery due to having contractions, Tom stepped in and finished. Despite a brief hiccup, he was able to resect the tumor and the met in one surgery and told Dana and her new husband that Guthrie would be okay with some radiation.



She is married to [[Ed Hamilton]]. Before Ed, she was married to [[Tom Koracick]], but their marriage fell apart after the death of their son.


Her first son, David, died when he was ten after being hit in the head with a baseball bat.

Her second son, Guthrie, bore a strong resemblance to David. When he was ten, they learned he had a brain tumor that had spread to his spine and Dana worried she'd lose another son.

'''Dana Martin''' is the mother of [[Clervie Martin]].


Dana's daughter, Clervie, was born with craniosynostosis, which caused her skull to fuse prematurely. Her pediatrician told her parents it was a mild case and would resolve on its own, but by the time she was three, it hadn't and she had an abnormally-shaped skull. Tom found her case and offered the parents a pro bono surgery in exchange for being allowed to film the surgery and their family before and after. Having no other way to afford the surgery, they agreed, though it made them visibly uncomfortable.

Noticing their discomfort and wanting to ease it, Jackson went to the parents and gave them the option to decline the cameras access, promising that they wouldn't have to pay for Clervie's surgery either way. They chose to proceed without the cameras. Clervie's surgery went well and her parents sat by her bed in the PICU afterward.



She is married to [[Peter Martin]].


She and Peter have one daughter, Clervie.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Martin, Dana}}

'''Daniel Lima''' is the father of [[Fernanda Lima]].


Daniel's daughter, Fernanda, had congenital heart disease that caused aortic stenosis. She'd had two prior open-heart surgeries and made a trip with her family from Boston to Seattle for a third. Her condition made it unsafe for her to fly on a commercial airplane, so her parents used a crowdfunding website to raise money, which they used to get an RV and drive across the country. On the way, they stopped at several tourist attractions. By the time they reached Seattle, Fernanda was starting to feel dizzy, so they rushed her directly to the PICU. Daniel also had some back pain, which he attributed to spending so much time driving. Fernanda was dehydrated, so they gave her fluids and ordered more tests, which showed that her aortic stenosis had gotten worse and they were forced to covert to a Ross-Konno Procedure. It carried additional risk, but her parents agreed to it because Maggie said it was the best option. The surgery went well and her family was told she'd be okay.



He is married to [[Angela Lima]].


He and his wife have two children: [[Rafael Lima|Rafael]] and [[Fernanda Lima|Fernanda]]. Fernanda had congenital aortic valve disease.


*He and his family are Brazilian.
*He speaks English and Portuguese.

'''Daniel Schwartz''' is Levi's Uncle Saul's boyfriend.


When Daniel heard that his boyfriend, Saul, was sick, he came to the nursing home only to find that Saul had already died. He then introduced himself to Levi and Nico, who didn't know that Saul was gay and knew that Levi was also gay. They talked and shared stories about Saul and then Daniel taught Levi how to prepare Saul's body.



He was in a long-term relationship with [[Saul]] before Saul's death. When Saul died, he came to the nursing home and helped Saul's nephew Levi prepare his body according to Jewish tradition.


His family was very accepting of him being gay.

'''Danny Nelstadt''' is the husband of [[Frank Nelstadt]].


Danny's husband, Frank, came into the ER with their daughter, Ella, when he had a very severe cough and sore throat. He'd had the cough for a few days and wasn't concerned, but Ella was worried and made him go to the hospital. While he was being examined, he had trouble breathing, which was resolved when he coughed up a blood clot which was shaped like a bronchial tree. When he started to struggle to breathe again, he was taken to have TPA injected to break up the clot. He was then diagnosed with Factor V leiden. As the condition is genetic, Danny immediately said Ella needed to be tested. They never wanted to know which of them was her biological father, but knew they needed to know if she had the same kind of condition, so she could properly maintain her health. The test came back positive, though Ella said it didn't matter because they're both her dads.



He is married to [[Frank Nelstadt]].


He and his husband have one daughter. When they had her, they chose not to know which of them was the biological father, unless she eventually wanted to know.

'''Danny Young''' is a child who was in a car accident with his father.


Danny was on a father-son trip with his father when his father passed out while driving and hit a tree. They were both taken to the emergency room, where Danny got stitches for a facial laceration. He had a head CT and it was clear, so Cormac discharged him and he left with his father. ''("[[Some Kind of Tomorrow]]")''

Danny returned to the hospital when his dad collapsed at work. At his father's request, Owen took Danny and played video games with him to distract him from what was going on. While they were together, Danny asked Owen if his dad was doing to die, as he had noticed that his father had trouble breathing and was a lot weaker than he used to be. At the end of the day, the family left the hospital together. ''("[[Everyday Is a Holiday (With You)]]")''



His father is dying of pulmonary fibrosis.


*He was seven years old at the time of the accident.

'''Dave Buckley''' is a high school teacher who passed out and pushed a child into a table saw.


Dave was trying to guide a student's hands into a table saw to cut some wood when he passed out, pushing the child, Kevin Gailis, into the saw and cutting off a few of his own fingers. He was rushed to the ER, where they examined his fingers. Link said that two of his fingers were too damaged to save and would have to be amputated. When Richard learned that Dave was drunk at the time of the accident, he asked to talk Dave through his withdrawal. During the procedure on his fingers, for which he was awake, Richard told him that what he was feeling was what rock bottom feels like. He denied being drunk, but Richard continued to probe until he was asked to leave the operating room.

Richard went into his room after his surgery and offered him a drink of vodka. He didn't drink it, but his labs showed that he was drunk again. Richard diagnosed him with auto-brewery syndrome, which fermented any sugar he ate, making him drunk.



His daughter lives in Maryland.


He has a strong relationship with his student, [[Arthur Krug]]. Arthur's mom says that he's a good influence and the only good male role model Arthur has in his life.


He teaches woodworking at Barrow High School.
