'''Manoj Joshi''' is a sex therapist who injured his hand while remodeling his office.


Manoj had seen an increase in demand for his services during the pandemic, meaning he could finally afford to update his home office. However, he decided to do the work himself instead of hiring professionals and ended up crushing his hand with a sandblaster. His x-ray didn't show any fractures, but he had swelling and pain. They did a CT, which showed a displaced fracture of the hook of the hamate, so they took him into surgery.

After surgery, Manoj was told he would make a full recovery, though it would take a few months to get the feeling back. He was told he'd need occupational therapy, but he said he had his own exercise regimen. He then shared with the doctors his secret. He said he asks his clients what they want and he listens to them.


He is a sex therapist. His business improved during the  pandemic.


*He had a narrowing of his ulnar artery, which Jackson said he saw often in patients who used vibrating power tools.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Joshi, Manoj}}

'''Marcella Diaz''' is a patient with COVID-.


Marcella and her daughter, Veronica, were living through the COVID- pandemic. Veronica was concerned because her mother was alone during the pandemic, so for her mother's birthday, she went over to her mother's house and cooked for her. They wore masks and ate outside and tried to stay distanced, but Veronica gave her mother a hug, which unknowingly transmitted COVID- to her. Veronica had a mild case, but her mother quickly ended up in the hospital with difficulty breathing. Marcella's condition declined, so they called her daughter to see what she wanted them to do, as Marcella had no healthcare directive, but learned Veronica was also at the hospital, as her own breathing had worsened. Veronica begged the doctors to focus on saving her mother while Marcella said to focus on saving her daughter. Soon after, both of them were in the position to need ventilators, but only one was available. As Veronica had the better chance of survival, she was put on the ventilator while Marcella was bagged. Then Maggie had an idea to split the ventilator using a y-shaped tube, allowing both of them to use the same ventilator.



She is very close with her daughter.


She was a high school music teacher for  years.


*She was  at the time of her hospitalization.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Diaz, Marcella}}

'''Margot Talbert''' \uees a patient with an abdominal aortic aneurysm that ruptured.


Margot came into the ER with throbbing abdominal pain that radiated to her back. She told the doctors it had started that morning. They examined her and find that her abdomen was pulsating, so they ordered a CT, which showed an abdominal aortic aneurysm. While she was in the CT, they asked if she could call anyone for her and she said no. She admitted that she'd been having the pain for a few months and said her wife would be angry to know she hadn't gotten it looked out because she told her wife she had. As they prepared for her surgery, Winston informed her they were obligated to notify next of kin and would be calling her wife. Margot was upset by that and Maggie told her that wasn't necessarily true. Winston asked her what would happen if she died. Margot then coded, because her aneurysm had ruptured. They rushed to start her surgery and were able to repair the damage. After her surgery, her wife came to see her and thanked the doctors for saving her life.



She is married to [[Hazel Talbert]].


*She was  at the time of her surgery.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Talbert, Margot}}

'''Mari Prishna''' is a woman who held her husband up for hours on an injured arm and nearly severed it.


Mari and her husband, Jai, were hiking. When they finished their hike, they stopped to take a picture. Jai stepped slightly back to take the photo and slipped off the cliff behind them. Mari grabbed onto the rope he was hanging from and, despite having an injury to her own shoulder, held on for several hours until Jackson, who was out walking after leaving Maggie in the woods, found them and helped Mari hold on. They stayed like that until Vic Hughes arrived and held wench him up. Mari and Jai were both taken to the hospital, where each had emergency surgery, her on her arms and him on his legs.

A week later, They were both recovering nicely from their initial surgeries. The doctors had managed to save both Jai's legs and Mari's fracture was healing, but she needed a second surgery to do nerve repair. Mari's surgery went well.

A week after that, Jai lost consciousness suddenly in his hospital room and Mari called for help. They diagnosed watershed infarctions, but had no idea what was causing them as he was young and healthy.

Another week later, Jai was on life support, something Mari knew he would hate. She planned to take him off life support, but just as they were doing so, Link and Amelia came in with something Amelia remembered about a past patient, who had a fat embolus come off a break and go to his brain. It looked the same as Jai and caused a tell-tale rash. She searched Jai's body for the rash and found it under his arm. They told Mari they might be able to wake Jai up.

For a week, Jai had experimental treatments, but still hadn't woken up. Mari wanted to stop treatments, worried it would make Jai just better enough that he wouldn't die. Andrew convinced her that it wasn't time yet to give up on Jai.

After another week of treatment, Mari had found a long-term care facility for Jai. However, she was surprised when the doctors took her to his room and he was awake. His exams all looked good, but he was still very weak. Mari kissed him and thanked all the doctors.



She is married to [[Jai Prishna]]. They like to go hiking together. When he fell off a cliff while taking a selfie, she held him up for hours until help arrived.


*She was  at the time of her hospitalization.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Prishna, Mari}}

'''Marie Cerone''' is the holder of the patent [[Meredith Grey]] needed for her research and an old family friend.



Marie was Meredith's "auntie" as she and Meredith's mother, [[Ellis Grey]] were once best friends. She frequently called Meredith "Mer-Mer" as a child and watched her grow up. Marie threw Meredith an eighth birthday party where she filled the entire bedroom floor to ceiling with balloons. Marie recalled Meredith being a "disembodied giggle" over it.

In her professional life, she worked on the laparoscopic biliary reconstruction with Ellis. This medical procedure became known as the Ellis Grey Procedure. The procedure was nominated for and later won a [[Catherine Fox Award|Harper Avery Award]], Ellis' second and final win. Marie, however, did not receive any credit for her contribution. ''("[[Games People Play]]")''


Marie came to Seattle to meet with Meredith when Meredith asked for use of her polymer in research. When she arrived, she and Meredith realized they knew each other when Meredith was a child because Marie and Ellis were best friends. They caught up on the lost time and then Meredith made her proposal. Marie was still unconvinced, and so Meredith had [[Taryn Helm]] bring out the mouse they had saved by secretly using Marie's polymer.

Marie then agreed that it was revolutionary and said after she had a good night's sleep, they'd meet and talk business. However, Meredith learned shortly afterward from [[Richard Webber]] that Marie and Ellis hated each other, which is why they were no longer best friends, and that Marie had likely stolen Meredith's idea. ''("[[Games People Play]]")''

When Meredith asked her about it, Marie said that Ellis had stolen the idea for the surgical innovation that won her her second Harper Avery. They had developed it together, but Ellis published the research solo before Marie could publish it jointly. In exchange, Marie wanted Meredith to announce Marie's contribution publicly and change the name of the procedure to the Grey-Cerone Method. Meredith told her she couldn't undo her mother's legacy without being able to hear her side of it. Marie then decided she would use her company's resources to fully develop the mini-livers before Meredith could do so and have them known as Cerones. ''([[Old Scars, Future Hearts]])'' 


When Meredith gave a presentation of her mini-livers, Marie attended. During the presentation, Meredith informed everyone about Marie's contribution to Ellis' surgical method and announced that she wanted the method to be now known as the Grey-Cerone Method<ref>Although called the Ellis Grey Procedure in "[[Old Scars, Future Hearts]]", Meredith calls it the Grey Method, which is how it is referred to in every other instance.</ref>. After the presentation, Marie tried to talk to Meredith, but Meredith said she'd said everything she wanted to say. ''("[[Fight For Your Mind]]")''


Meredith reached out to Marie in Spain to inquire if she could help her out on her quest to find Rhnull blood for [[Gus Carter]], but to no avail. ''("[[Head Over High Heels]]")''



Marie never married and never cared much for romantic relationships. ''([[Old Scars, Future Hearts]])'' 


She went back to Spain after time in the US because her father wanted her to run his company. Later, she took over ownership when her father died. She considered her father's death to be timely, as he had been sick for a long time. ''("[[Games People Play]]")''


[[Ellis Grey]]
She and [[Ellis Grey]] were best friends for many years. Marie considered Ellis to be the greatest love of her life. ''([[Old Scars, Future Hearts]])'' Sometime after Meredith's eighth birthday, they had a falling out.

[[Meredith Grey]]
Marie considered Meredith to be the closest thing she had to having children. She was very fond of her, and watched her work over the years as she grew into a surgeon. 


She is an [[Attending|attending]] [[General Surgery|general surgeon]].

When she and Ellis Grey worked together, she was sexually harassed by [[Harper Avery]] and was eventually paid a settlement as a result of that. Ellis Grey left her name off the paper publishing their work in order to win a [[Catherine Fox Award|Harper Avery Award]], which Marie was ineligible to win, ending their friendship and resulting in Marie returning to Spain to run her father\us company. At a presentation she was giving on her mini-livers, [[Meredith Grey]] announced that the Grey Method would be known as the Grey-Cerone Method to acknowledge Marie's contributions.

'''Martin Fields''' is the ICE agent who came for [[Sam Bello]].


Martin came to Grey Sloan and told Bailey he was looking for a surgical resident, Sam Bello. He was from immigration, so Bailey told him Bello was in surgery to delay him. While he was waiting for her to come out of surgery, Bailey noticed his carotid was bulging and eventually convinced him to have an EKG. The EKG was concerned, so Maggie ordered additional tests, which showed an almost-complete blockage of his coronary arteries, making him extremely high-risk for a heart attack. He had a cardiac catheterization to open his arteries. During his procedure, he talked about how he used to like doing his job, but didn't anymore.



He is married.


He is an agent for Immigration and Customs Enforcement. He chose that career because he wanted to be the good guy who came in and fixed everything, but he has since lost the joy in his job.


*He grew up watching Westerns.

'''Marvin''' is the husband of [[Lucille Reid]].


Marvin came to the hospital with his wife, Lucille. Lucille was at the hospital for a syncopal work-up after falling at home. The work-up showed nothing, but when her friend, [[Julian]], mentioned that she'd been dizzy, Teddy ordered a CT Angio and a neuro consult. The test results showed stenosis and an aneurysm, so she had surgery for both problems at once. She was stable and awake after her surgery.



He is married to [[Lucille Reid]]. He's her third husband and hopes to be her last, saying he accepts what she has with Julian and knows she won't pick him over Julian.

'''Mary Ann''' is a woman who gave birth at the hospital while her grandfather was being treated for a stroke.


Mary Ann's grandfather, [[William Lawrence]], had had COVID a few months prior and was treated at the urban Indian Health Clinic successfully. A few months later, he had right-sided paralysis and aphasia, so she took him back to the clinic, where [[James Chee]] sent him to the hospital, suspecting he was having a stroke. At the hospital, they confirmed that he'd had a stroke due a clot and told Mary Ann they'd go and remove it. She emphasized how important her grandfather was to their tribe before going into labor in the parking lot.

She was taken inside, where they were unable to get her own OB, the same OB who had delivered her, because she was busy with a premature twin delivery. Carina stepped in and successfully delivered her daughter, whom she and her husband, [[Shawn (Tradition)|Shawn]], named Rosie after her mother. After her birth, they did a video call with William, who proceeded to tell Rosie the story of their family.



She is married to [[Shawn (Tradition)|Shawn]].


She is very close with her family. When she gave birth, she requested to have her parents there.

'''Mary Rose Hawkins-Garrett''' is a girl who got a bad sunburn on her arms.


Mary Rose was born with xeroderma pigementosum, which left her extremely vulnerable to ultraviolet light. One day, she was admitted to the hospital because she had second degree burns on both her arms. Her mothers said they didn't know how it happened because they were always so careful and Mary Rose also claimed not to know anything about it. The burns were so severe that Mary Rose was taken into surgery for debridement. After her debridement, she admitted that she'd run outside after her cat, who had escaped. She was worried her cat would get hit by a car, so she put on her helmet, but not her jacket, which is how she got the burns. Jackson agreed not to tell her moms, but said that was a one-time offer. Mary Rose said the burns hurt, so she definitely wouldn't go out without her jacket again.


*She was diagnosed when she was six months old.
*She has a cat named Miss Velma.
*She was  years old at the time of her hospitalizaion.

'''MaryAnn Suchan''' is an employee of the Medical Accreditation Council who investigated the residency program at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]].


MaryAnn came to [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]] after the Medical Accreditation Council received over fifteen complaints about their residency program within six months. When she arrived, she had trouble finding a person she could talk to about the investigation they were launching into Grey Sloan, which aimed to determine if the program should be shut down. When Teddy told her Richard wasn't in for the day, she searched for Bailey, only to find that Owen was acting as chief for the day. She finally sat down with Owen and explained the situation to him, saying they were considering shutting the whole residency program down. ''("[[Road Trippin']]")''

Another day, she returned to Grey Sloan with [[Jamarah Blake]] to interview the attendings about the program. They wanted to interview residents, but they were all on grand rounds with [[Nick Marsh]], except [[Levi Schmitt]], who had left the program. They noted that the program had lost seven surgeons in the last year as Bailey showed them around the hospital.

Once the tour was over, they began interviewing attendings, all of whom defended the program and its efficacy. They also interviewed [[Jo Wilson]], who spoke about her decision to change from surgery to obstetrics, but still defended the surgical residency program. After speaking to her, they asked to speak to Richard next. Bailey suggested they go take a break and she'd bring him to them. At the end of the day, they said that they had a top-quality program, but they simply didn't have enough surgeons to keep the program running. They put the program on probation and left Bailey a list of concrete steps she needed to take before their return in a few weeks, telling her if she didn't make the changes, the program would be shut down. ''("[[Put It to the Test]]")''


She works for the Medical Accreditation Council.

'''Matty Britland''' is the daughter of [[Suzanne Britland]].


Matty's mother, Suzanne, was post-op day three on an appendectomy, but still in the hospital because she had a high white count and fever, but no sepsis. She admitted to a sore throat during rounds, but hoped to get some antibiotics and get discharged that day anyway. Her daughters were missing school because they refused to leave the hospital without her after losing their father less than a year prior after a doctor said he'd be okay and sent him home. They did a CT and during the CT, she crashed and they were forced to do a pericardiocentesis in the CT booth to relieve the cardiac tamponade. They sent the fluid to the lab for testing, but had to admit they didn't know what was going on with her. ''("[[A Hard Pill to Swallow]]")''

Desperate, Andrew called in [[Lauren Riley]], an expert diagnostician from UCSF. After having Maggie do a pericardial window to relieve the pressure of the fluid around her heart, Lauren said they need to withdraw all treatment, so that they could see the symptoms without the medications. Suzanne was reluctant, but ultimately agreed to let them withdraw all treatments. ''("[[Save the Last Dance for Me]]")''

Suzanne's previously treated symptoms started to appear again, causing discomfort. They continued to run tests, which still didn't show anything conclusive. Finally, after Andrew noticed that Suzanne's platelet count had dropped almost to zero, they did a bone marrow biopsy. That showed hemophagocytosis, a result of macrophage activation syndrome, a known complication of Still's disease, which she had prior to the appendectomy without knowing it. They have her high-dose steroids, which caused her to feel better almost immediately and said she'd be referred to a rheumatologist to manage her condition. Her kids were both excited to get to see her healthy again. ''("[[A Diagnosis]]")''



During a class field trip, she kissed a classmate named Taylor Olson. The school called her aunt, who then told her mother, not knowing that Taylor is a girl. ''("[[Save the Last Dance for Me]]")''


Following the recent death of her father, she was very concerned about her mother being in the hospital and refused to leave her, even to go to school.


*She was  at the time of her mother's hospitalization.

'''Maureen Lincoln''' is the mother of [[Atticus Lincoln]].



On the anniversary of the day Link's doctor told him he didn't have cancer anymore, Maureen and Eric came to Seattle to have lunch to celebrate, a tradition. Link said previous meals always devolved into the two them comparing their lives to determine who had a better one since the divorce, but he had high hopes for this one because he and Amelia could tell them they're going to be grandparents. At the lunch, Maureen said she was getting remarried to Eric. He'd moved to Denver for work and joined a dating app to meet people. Maureen was his first match, so he moved to a different app. Two more apps also paired them, so they decided to get coffee and rekindled their relationship. Link was angry because they put him through the wringer getting divorced and always put him between them and now they've worked it out. He told them about the pregnancy and when they were discussing timing of the baby, they noted that they had put a deposit down on a wedding venue, but when that upset Link even more, they said they could change it.


Despite the [[COVID- Pandemic]], Eric and Maureen decided to go forward with their wedding, making their son fearful that they'd get COVID. ''("[[It's All Too Much]]")''

Later, Eric and Maureen bought an RV, packed it with supplies, and drove it from Colorado to Seattle. For two weeks, they had no contact with anyone but each other. When they arrived in Seattle, they were excited to meet Scout and offered to take all four kids to see Mt. Rainier so Amelia and Link could have some time to themselves. ''("[[Sorry Doesn't Always Make It Right]]")''

Another day, Maureen came inside to babysit Bailey and Ellis while Maggie took Zola to the hospital to see Meredith and try to get her to wake up. ''("[[Good as Hell]]")''



She is currently engaged to her ex-husband, Eric. They had a contentious divorce and made their son go between them when he was just a child. However, after being apart, they were matched on three different dating websites and decided to get coffee. Things went well between them and they decided to get re-married.


She and Eric have one son, Link.

'''Melissa Gailis''' is the mother of Kevin Gailis.


Melissa and her husband, [[Brad Gailis|Brad]], came to the hospital when their son, Kevin, was pushed into a table saw while he was at school. They were horrified to learn that the teacher, [[Dave Buckley]], was drunk at the time. Kevin was taken into surgery, where the saw blade was removed and his injuries were repaired. It looked like he might lose his arm because the blood flow had been compromised, but Maggie was ultimately able to save it and Kevin was stable and awake afterward. It was proven that Buckley hadn't been drinking and Buckley came to visit Kevin in his recovery room.



She is married to [[Brad Gailis]].


She and her husband have a son, Kevin, who was injured when he was pushed into a table saw.

{{Attending Infobox |image = x-.jpg |name = Michelle Lin |status = Alive |title = M.D., [[Fellow of the American College of Surgeons|F.A.C.S.]] |job = '''Current''' *[[Attending#Department Head|Head]] of [[Plastic Surgery]] *[[Attending]] [[Otolaryngology|ENT]] '''Former'''
[[Attending#Department Head|Assistant Head]] of [[Plastic Surgery]] |workplace = '''Current'''
[[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]] '''Former'''
Unknown Hospital |first appearance = [[Here Comes the Sun]] |last appearance = [[Stronger Than Hate]] |count = |seasons = '''[[Grey's Anatomy|GA]]:''' [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]] |portrayed by = [[Lynn Chen]] }} '''Michelle Lin''' is the head of plastic surgery at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]]. After the pandemic, Michelle interviewed to replace [[Jackson Avery|Dr. Jackson Avery]] at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]] as they'd been unable to fill the position due to a nationwide physician shortage. During her interview, they were surprised she'd never run a department on her own, but had rather assisted the department head, but she defended that Bailey had never been chief until she was. The interview was interrupted when Richard came in and asked Michelle to scrub in on an emergency surgery on [[Brad DiMarco]], who had injured his face when a firework went off. They continued the interview in the OR, as she said she thinks more clearly in there. In the surgery, she became inpatient with Levi when she had to ask multiple times for instruments. After she completed the surgery, Bailey officially offered her the job, but she turned it down, saying their residents weren't at the level she required, as she heavily depended on residents in her work. Richard said that happened because the pandemic stole an entire year from them and he promised he would catch them up. ''("[[Here Comes the Sun]]")'' Despite her resistance, Michelle took the job at Grey Sloan. During the heat wave, she treated [[Chet]], who had burned his butt and upper thighs on the hot sidewalk while filming a video for social media. ''("[[Hotter Than Hell]]")'' Michelle later went with Bailey to a recruitment fair to try to court medical students to apply to their program. She helped Bailey talk about the program and hand out brochures, to minimal interest. Michelle encouraged Bailey to publicize the Webber Method, in the hopes it would draw potential candidates in. Bailey had Levi and Mabel come and demonstrate how the Method worked, but the medical students were unable to understand how it was better than what other programs offered. ''("[[Today Was a Fairytale]]")'' Lin attended the M&M that discussed the death of [[Devon Gomez]]. She questioned use of the Webber Method, despite having used it as a recruitment tool for new residents. ''("[[Living In a House Divided]]")'' Lin worked on [[Alice Tom]] when she came into the ER after being attacked at a bus stop for being Asian-American. Alice had severe facial trauma, requiring surgery. As Lin operated, she shared her experience as a child wondering if she could use her mother's make-up to look more American, which in her mind meant more white. After Nico shared feelings of also feeling like an outsider, BokHee assured them both that their faces were American faces. ''("[[Stronger Than Hate]]")'' At her former hospital, she served as the [[Attending#Department Head|assistant head]] of [[Plastic Surgery|plastics]]. She described her previous head of plastics as a man who enjoys vacation homes and only hired women because he was obligated. Some time before that, she completed her [[Resident|residency]] in [[Otolaryngology|otolaryngology]] at NYU, where her mentor, Dr. Joyce Wu, taught her how to use an -gauge needle to differentiate between living and dead tissue, even in the most extreme of cases. She then went on to complete a [[Fellow|plastics fellowship]]. When she manages residents as an attending, she moves quickly and teaches by doing. Her style of teaching relies on the residents' abilities to keep up as she does not have the time to go through each step in detail nor hold their hands. Given the high-level surgeries in her caseload and practice, she expects her residents to anticipate her next move. During her interview at Grey-Sloan, she was granted surgical privileges by [[Richard Webber|Dr. Webber]] on an emergent plastics case. After her interview, she was offered the head of plastics position, but expressed a concern of the residents' competency given her management style. Despite Dr. Webber committing to fast-track their education, she asked for some time to consider the offer. ''("[[Here Comes the Sun]]")'' She eventually accepted the position, and she is currently the Head of Plastic Surgery and an [[Attending|attending]] [[Otolaryngology|ENT surgeon]] at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]]. ''("[[Hotter Than Hell]]")'' *She hates northern winters, implying her former place of work is in a northern city that is notable for their winters. *Like then [[Attending#Department Head|Head]] of [[Plastic Surgery]] [[Mark Sloan|Dr. Mark Sloan]], her background includes a surgical residency in [[Otolaryngology|ENT]] and a fellowship in plastics. xMichelleLin.png|[[Here Comes the Sun]] xMichelleLin.png|[[Hotter Than Hell]] xMichelleLin.png|[[Today Was a Fairytale]] x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg {{Michelle Lin Appearances}} [[de:Michelle Lin]] {{DEFAULTSORT:Lin, Michelle}} [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:GA Characters]] [[Category:GA S Characters]] [[Category:Doctors]]

'''Michelle Williams''' is the mother of [[J.J. Williams]].


Michelle's son, J.J., fell while trying to climb the fence with his friend and broke his arm. He was examined in the ER and an x-ray was ordered to confirm. It confirmed the break, but also revealed a mass, which a biopsy showed was osteosarcoma. J.J.'s mother, Michelle, was worried about him dying and J.J. was worried about being bald, but Link reassured them both, saying he had the same kind of cancer when he was a kid and survived and letting J.J. cut his hair.



When she learned her son had cancer, she was worried about him dying. Link spoke to her privately and said the worst part for him when he had the same kind of cancer as a kid was seeing his mother so sad all the time. He encouraged her to let J.J. see her smile at least once a day.

'''Mr. Tom''' is the husband of [[Alice Tom]].


Mr. Tom and his wife, Alice, were preparing for dinner with their family when they realized they didn't have chocolate syrup for sundaes, so Alice went to go get it. Her husband offered to drive her, but she insisted on taking the bus. While she was waiting at the bus stop, someone attacked her simply because she's Asian-American. She was found and brought to the ER, where they examined her and began treating her injuries, which included facial trauma, abdominal trauma, and a broken humerus. She had a CT, which showed a splenic laceration, but it was minor, so Meredith decided to watch it to see if it would resolve itself while Nico and Lin operated on her arm and face. Her surgery went well and she was moved to the ICU afterward, but when her spleen ruptured, Meredith was forced to open her up in her room and stop the bleeding. After her second surgery, her family was told she'd be okay.



He is married to [[Alice Tom]].


Many members of his family came to the hospital when his wife was attacked. They have weekly family dinners.

'''Mr. Wright''' is the husband of [[Ashley Wright]].


Mr. Wright came to the hospital when his wife, Ashley, was told she'd need surgery on a ruptured appendix. Because it had ruptured, the surgery carried a risk of emergency c-section and potentially even a hysterectomy. Before her surgery, Ashley told her husband that she couldn't have any more kids as she feared she would die. So she asked Jo to tie her tubes if she didn't have to do a hysterectomy. Ashley was taken into surgery, where they ended up having to deliver her baby and remove her uterus to stop the bleeding. Afterward, Mr. Wright was told that Ashley would be okay and so would their son, who was in the NICU for monitoring. When he questioned why she hadn't just told him sooner that she didn't want more kids, Jo said that society makes it hard for women to ask for help and suggested that he help without waiting for his wife to ask.



He is married to [[Ashley Wright]].


He and his wife have five children. For Thanksgiving, they had a total of  people in their house, including his parents, who were in town on open-ended tickets.

'''Ms. Baner''' is the mother of [[Frankie Baner]].


Her son, Frankie, had had a stroke due to a disorder that made his blood clot more readily than normal. He was in the hospital to have an AVM embolization when the computers were hacked and blocked access to Frankie's medical records. This left them unsure of if he got the vitamin K to reverse his anti-coagulants. When Frankie developed a headache, they ran a CT, but it didn't show anything, though it was likely it was too early to see anything. As he worsened, Jo raced around the hospital, trying to track down the nurses who had worked on Frankie to see whether he'd gotten the vitamin K or not. Meanwhile, Alex and Amelia continued monitoring him and decided based on his medical history to give him the heparin, just as Jo learned that he hadn't gotten his vitamin K, so heparin would kill him. ''("[[Out of Nowhere]]")''

After he was given the heparin, Frankie got worse instead of better, tipping them off that it had been the wrong choice. They took him for an angio, which showed a bleed. They took him into surgery to place a shunt and they were able to stop the bleeding. He was stable and awake afterward. ''("[[---]]")''



Her son has a blood disorder that causes his blood to clot abnormally.


*She had a crush on Alex.

'''Myrna Schmitt''' is the mother of [[Levi Schmitt]].



When Levi brought Nico home, Myrna checked on them and brought Levi some soup. When Levi said that Nico was his boyfriend and that Nico had a bad week, Myrna gave Nico the soup instead and told Levi they'd talk later. ''("[[Jump Into the Fog]]")''


Myrna heard from a cousin that Saul was very close to death and told Levi that if he wanted to see Saul, he should go immediately. Levi went and after Saul died, he learned that Saul was gay and had a long-term boyfriend, [[Daniel Schwartz]]. Levi went home and started packing. He told Myrna that saying she accepted him meant nothing when she refused to let him tell anyone else in the family. This led him to decide to move out. ''("[[The Last Supper]]")''


On Thanksgiving, Myrna came to the hospital and brought food for Levi and Nico. She knew he was busy, so she said she would set it up and he could come eat whenever he had the time. Later in the day, Nico came to sit with her and eat because Levi was stuck in surgery and he didn't want her to be alone. She told Nico stories about Levi as they ate together. When Levi finally came to the cafeteria, Myrna went to leave, saying she'd already eaten. She invited both Nico and Levi to come visit her anytime. ''("[[Everyday Is a Holiday (With You)]]")''


When [[Devon Gomez]] died while Levi was operating on him, Levi quit the program and moved back in with his mom. He spent his days playing video games until Taryn came and told him the residency program was under review. He looked into the memes about it online and found out that his mother had posted many. They argued about it, with her saying that the residency program had broken him and him defending that he was the one who failed the program, not the other way around. While they were fighting, Myrna slipped on the basement stairs and fell, breaking her femoral neck and some ribs. Levi immediately called , then started treating her. When he decided the ambulance was taking too long, he called Richard, who talked him through a thoracostomy to relieve the pressure in her chest from what he thought was a tension pneumothorax. When he did so, he learned it was a hemopneumothorax. Firefighters then arrived and took Myrna to the hospital, where she was rushed into surgery. After her surgery, she was stable and Levi sat by her bedside. ''("[[Put It to the Test]]")''



She and her son are very close. He lived in her basement and she weighed in on all the decisions he has to make until he decided following the death of his uncle Saul that he couldn't anymore.


*She used to sing Shalom Rav to Levi when he couldn't sleep.<ref>[[Jump Into the Fog]], x</ref>
*Her social media username is MommaMyrna.<ref>[[Put It to the Test]], x</ref>
*She lives at  Northside Drive.<ref>[[Put It to the Test]], x</ref>

'''Nadia Correa''' is a woman who crashed a tandem bike into Teddy and Owen's Wedding.


Nadia and her wife, Emma, had just sent their son off to college. Desperate not to become that couple who just grows to hate each other, Emma bought a tandem bike and signed them up for the Undies bike race. They were racing when Emma saw an anti-oil activist with something interesting written on her body, but when she tried to read it, she steered them off the path and into Teddy and Owen's wedding, injuring [[Father Christopher]], the priest marrying them, and both Nadia and Emma. They were taken to the emergency room, where Emma was admitted for observation, while Nadia's more severe injuries were assessed. She had numbness in her feet and an x-ray showed multiple spinal fractures. While they were examining her, she complained that she was overheated, so Link ordered an MRI as he suspected damage to her autonomic nervous system. By the time she got to the MRI, she was freezing. The MRI showed a tethered spinal cord and syrinx. She told the doctors she'd always had trouble with her back, but worked through it and was unaware that her spinal cord was tethered, which was causing the pain. They took her into surgery, where they repaired the first fracture and then flipped her to clip the cord and repair the other fracture. After Amelia clipped the cord, they briefly believed she was paralyzed, but they found that she was just bleeding and they were able to repair the damage. Her wife was told she'd make a full recovery, though the priest they hit died, leaving Emma worried Nadia would continue to hate her, as she believed Nadia already did.



She is married to [[Emma Correa]].


She and Emma have a son who just went away to college.

'''Natasha Deon''' is a patient who fell from a hotel balcony.


Before their wedding, Natasha and her fianc\ue, [[Garrett Boland]], decided to spend the night apart, so she got her own hotel room. She was out on the balcony when it broke, sending her falling three floors to the ground. She was taken to the ER, where they determined she had a broken, windswept pelvis. They took her into the OR, where she had a splenectomy and her pelvis was externally fixated. After her surgery, she was put into a medically-induced coma. ''("[[Help, I'm Alive]]")''

Garrett waited by Natasha's bedside for weeks while she slept. After a month, they took her off the sedatives, and she woke up on Christmas Eve. On New Years Eve, she was off the ventilator and speaking. However, after that, she started to decline again. She was put on dialysis and back on the ventilator. After  days in the hospital, Natasha and Garrett decided to have the doctors turn the ventilator off. They then gave them the wedding they wanted, with phones displaying star pictures, in her hospital room, right before she died. ''("[[Girlfriend in a Coma]]")''



She was engaged to [[Garrett Boland]] when she fell from a balcony on the eve of their wedding. They later married in her hospital room right before she died. ''("[[Girlfriend in a Coma]]")''


*She got migraines sometimes.
*She had a scar from an appendectomy.
*She bought a blue dress for her wedding.

{{Attending Infobox |image = x-.jpg |name = Nick Marsh |status = Alive |title = M.D., [[Fellow of the American College of Surgeons|F.A.C.S.]] |parents = *Mother \u *Father |siblings = Erica Marsh |other family = [[Charlotte Marsh]] ''(niece)'' |job = *[[Attending]] [[Transplant Surgery|Transplant Surgeon]] *Director of the Residency Program |workplace = '''Current'''
[[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]]
'''Former'''
[[Mayo Clinic]] |first appearance = [[One Day Like This]] |count = |seasons = '''[[Grey's Anatomy|GA]]:''' [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]], [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]], and [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]] |portrayed by = [[Scott Speedman]] }} '''Nick Marsh''' is an attending and Director of the Residency Program at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]] and is currently in a relationship with [[Meredith Grey]]. He previously worked at [[Mayo Clinic]] in Minnesota. Five weeks after having a kidney transplant, Nick came to [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]] to retrieve a liver for a long-time patient of his. After the surgery, he collapsed in a hallway because he returned to work earlier than recommended. Meredith did an exam and ran some labs. He flirted with her and they talked and laughed while waiting for the results to come back and they got to know a bit about each other. His labs were inconclusive, so Meredith did another ultrasound, which showed a clot in his renal vein cutting off blood flow to his new kidney. While she rushed him into surgery, Nick entrusted Meredith with the code for his niece's college fund and asked her to make sure Charlotte attended college, just in case he didn't make it. His worry was unnecessary though, as she was able to remove the clot and save his kidney.[[One Day Like This]], x Nick was leaving a bad date at the restaurant where Meredith was having dinner with [[David Hamilton]]. When he was leaving, they exchanged a brief look. Intent on meeting her, he took a chance and guessed she would be staying at the five-star hotel near the hospital. He waited for her at the bar and had an employee escort her to the bar upon her arrival. She said thought he hadn't seen her, but he replied that she's hard to miss. Over drinks, he told her about his terrible date while when she mentioned that she had recently ended a relationship. He told her that Charlotte wanted him to thank her for saving his life saying that's the deepest conversation he could get from her from a loud dorm. Meredith was happy for him since when they first met, he told her he wanted for his niece to go to college. Even though he was happy for Charlotte, he said his house felt too quiet. Meredith talked about having survived COVID and Nick understood the pressure she was feeling to make the most of her life after her miraculous survival. After another drink, he escorted her to her room. She shared that she was staying for a few more days and repeated she would not be inviting him, which wasn't his intent. They flirted a little as he walked off.[[Here Comes the Sun]], x He returned to her hotel room to slide a note under her door but got caught since she was still awake. He wanted to ask her out on a date without waking her up since he had forgotten to ask for her number. She agreed to a date by the lake. Later in the day, she glanced at Nick while walking Amelia back to the car. In the evening, she arrived in the hotel lobby all dressed up only to spot him in casual clothes. He asked her to change and drove her out to his favorite spot by the water. As they listened to the sounds of nature and stargazed, he said he had pulled back on his hours to enjoy life more because he was missing the good little things around him. He then inquired about the top secret project that she was in town for. She admitted to being scared of saying yes due to fear of public failure given the high stakes. Nick knew her well enough to know that she was ready to trade in her safe and comfortable situation in Seattle for the project. He wasn't a safety person either and told her it would be one hell of a ride no matter the outcome. Later that night, she accepted Hamilton's offer.[[Some Kind of Tomorrow]], x Meredith ended up accepting the position in Minnesota, splitting her time between there and Seattle. Nick ran into her in the parking lot after having just performed a liver transplant. He invited her to dinner that night. She accepted and told him to get some rest, after which she headed into the building as he smilingly stared after her.[[With a Little Help From My Friends]], x When David threw a tantrum, Meredith sought out Nick to gain intel on David. Nick knew that Hamilton has Parkinson's and was using a lot of his money on the project. Seeing who was involved in the project, he assumed that David Hamilton wanted a solution to his problem. Meredith was surprised that Nick knew anything about her project. He told her that David was not in it for the greater good. Meredith was disappointed that she fell for his charm and thought of him as an investor rather than a desperate surgeon. Nick pointed out how hard it must be for David to feel himself become obsolete and advised her to cut him some slack yet not let him walk over her. She took his advice and smoothed things over with David. At the end of the day, they met on a rooftop terrace for another date and ended up sharing their first kiss.[[Bottle Up and Explode!]], x After the success with the Parkinson's Project, when David Hamilton offered Meredith a position at Mayo, she decided to accept the offer, as she felt that people at Grey Sloan still saw her as the intern she once was. Knowing that the residency program was struggling, Nick suggested that Meredith stay until the program was secure. He also offered to help cover staff shortages.[[Should I Stay or Should I Go]], x Despite their efforts, the residency program was shut down and Bailey quit, so Jackson offered Meredith a job as Chief of Surgery. She decided to stay and told Nick to go back to Minnesota.[[You Are the Blood]], x After six months without talking to each other, they met again due during a big bus accident which led multiple organ donors to Grey Sloan with several transplant surgeons there, including Nick. Meredith asked him to stay and do a triple organ transplant for a patient of hers since it was the first day of the new residency program and she couldn't be away in a OR for so many hours. After this long procedure, Nick thanked Meredith for the surgery because it was the first time he had done a triple organ transplant. She stopped him when he tried to leave, asking him stay and offering him the job of Residency Program Director at Grey Sloan, saying he was the best for the job.[[Everything Has Changed]], x After thinking about it, he said yes and started working at Grey Sloan. To Meredith surprise, he was professional towards her, while she expected an email or for him to go to her office, so at the end of the day, she paged him to talk about a budget request for new component of the residency program. Then she segued into her asking him why he he barely spoke to her all day. They got interrupted by Owen and seeing how busy Meredith was, Nick told her to talk to him if she had any doubts about the program. Before he could leave the office, she asked him to talk. He said they didn't have time for that "back and forth" because people were always asking for her. Meredith told him that when he got back to Minnesota, she went numb and that's why she didn't call him and assured him that she still loved him. Nick asked her to dinner but she said no, but instead she asked him to go with her to Zola's presentation for the North Pacific scholars, which he accepted.[[Wasn't Expecting That]], x He sees himself as an easy person to talk to and he isn't a comfortable person. Nick sees adventures as something that can go well or poorly, but either way he likes to try and do it so he can know if the outcome is worth it. While he was in the hospital, he flirted heavily with Meredith and the two chatted for hours as they waited for his lab results. At the end of the day, Meredith confided in Alex that Nick made her feel something for the first time since she lost Derek. When Meredith began traveling frequently to Minnesota to develop a cure for Parkinson's, they struck up a relationship. When he told Meredith he was falling in love with her, he mentioned that he doesn't fall in love easily and he has done so very rarely in his life. Even with the distance from Seattle and Minnesota, their relationship got developing and after the success of the Parkinson's project, Meredith got an offer from [[David Hamilton]] so she could join [[Mayo Clinic]] as Chief of General Surgery and have control over [[The Grey Center]]. After some time, she decided to leave and take the new job without knowing the residency program at Grey Sloan was on probation. Nick saw how the people in the hospital felt about her leaving and he didn't want her to resent him in the future so he moved to Seattle, using his personal days off and working locum tenens at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]] to help her and the hospital so the program would not be shut down and she could leave without feeling guilty or in bad terms with the people she knows. Despite their work, the residency program got shut down, Bailey quit, giving Meredith the key of the chief's office and Jackson pressured her to stay and save the place. Meredith told Nick to go back to Minnesota because she had a lot of work to do for the hospital.[[You Are the Blood]], x For the next six months, neither of them tried to contact the other until Nick came back to Seattle to retrieve an organ. Maggie saw him in line talking with Winston while waiting for his turn and went to Meredith's office to tell her to go talk with him, adding that even Zola noticed how sad Meredith had been and had asked her for Nick's phone number so she could call him and ask him to return. Meredith went to Nick and asked him to do a triple organ transplant on her patient and he agreed. After the transplant was completed, Meredith offered Nick a job as an attending and Director of the Residency Program, an offer he accepted.[[Everything Has Changed]], x On Nick's first day at Grey Sloan, to Meredith surprise, he was professional towards her, while she expected an email or for him to go to her office, so at the end of the day, she paged him to talk about a budget request for new component of the residency program. Then she segued into her asking him why he he barely spoke to her all day. They got interrupted by Owen and seeing how busy Meredith was, Nick told her to talk to him if she had any doubts about the program. Before he could leave the office, she asked him to talk. He said they didn't have time for that "back and forth" because people were always asking for her. Meredith told him that when he got back to Minnesota, she went numb and that's why she didn't call him and assured him that she still loved him. Nick asked her to dinner but she said no, but instead she asked him to go with her to Zola's presentation for the North Pacific scholars, which he accepted.[[Wasn't Expecting That]], x His father used to take him to the Boundary Waters between Minnesota and Canada. His dad would get a look on his face that Nick would like to experience. His dad left his family when Nick was years old.[[Haunted]], x His mother died when he was fifteen of heart failure while waiting for a heart transplant. He described her as "impossibly smart" and he likes to think she's proud of him. Until his father left him and his mother, his neighborhood was his whole world. After Nick's father left, his mother bought an RV and over spring break, they went to the Grand Canyon. Until then, he'd never been outside of Minnesota and it made him realize there was this big beautiful world were no one knew or cared he was the kid whose dad left him. His mother showed him there was more than the place and realities he knew and he was thankful for her gesture.[[Haunted]], x After his sister, Erica, bailed due to her struggles with drug dependency, he took in his niece, Charlotte, and raised her as his own saying it was the best thing he ever did. She was sixteen at the time of his hospitalization. He doesn't see his sister much because she has an uncanny ability to break his heart and enrage him all in once. Whether she's sober or not, she lies to him without remorse. Despite that, he struggles to say no when she asks for something and so the distance he established is the easiest way to avoid a heartbreak and to keep his and Charlotte's lives on track. He is very protective of Charlotte and always did his best for her. When Nick took Meredith to his cabin for a romantic weekend, Charlotte showed up with her boyfriend whom Nick hadn't met before and didn't like very much. Over dinner, his niece told him she wanted to leave college for a while so she could travel and spend some time in Costa Rica. Nick wanted her to finish school first, causing a conflict between the two of them. Later that night, Meredith told Charlotte she reminded of herself at that age. Meredith encouraged them to talk and Charlotte explained to Nick that she wanted to get a chance to mess up a little alone without him telling her what was good for her. He explained that he did it so she didn't have to struggle and to help her keep from becoming like her mother, but Charlotte stopped him and asked him to give himself some credit because if it weren't for him, she couldn't even dream about traveling the world. She assured him she would get back to college, that he did a great job raising her, and she was grateful for him. Nick agreed to give her more space, but asked to meet her the next week so they could talk about the places she would be visiting in Costa Rica.[[The Makings of You]] His [[Brian Williams (Today Was a Fairytale)|best friend]] donated a kidney to him. They have been friends since they were five years old, used to go camping every summer and played Little League together.[[Today Was a Fairytale]], x He is a world-class [[Transplant Surgery|transplant surgeon]]. During his [[General Surgery|surgical]] [[Resident|residency]], he had a fondness for all the [[Specialties#Surgical Specialty|specialities]], especially [[Cardiothoracic Surgery|cardio]] and [[Neurosurgery|neuro]], but he couldn't sit still and wanted to travel, which transplant surgery afforded him. As an attending, he teaches that the organ isn't just an organ. He insists on teaching his students that to be a great transplant surgeon, it's important to remember that an organ it's one of the greatest gifts a human being can give to another human being and they can not forget the person who gave the gifts. Unlike most of the transplant surgeons, when he has the opportunity, Nick likes to meet the people who have lost someone, offer his condolences, and get to know a little about the person who is donating the organs.[[Legacy]], x He was involved in a study on liver transplant with HIV-Positive organ donors and recipients that required a lot of travel.[[The Makings of You]], x He is studying stem cell therapies and xenotransplantation and successfully did a xenotransplantation with a genetically-modified pig kidney.[[Put It to the Test]], x After the residency program at Grey Sloan restarted, six months after the shut down, Meredith offered Nick the job to be in charge of the program because she said he was the best teacher she knows and how much he cares about people.[[Everything Has Changed]], x Nick accepted the position.[[Wasn't Expecting That]], x *He was on dialysis for only a month before his kidney transplant. *He believes that doctors make the worst patients. *After his kidney transplant, surgery and his niece Charlotte were his priorities.[[Everyday Is a Holiday (With You)]], x *He was the first member of his family to go to college. *Nick did his residency in D.C. and his fellowship in Minnesota. *Before his mother died, he had never considered a career in medicine.[[Let's Talk About Sex]], x *His plan B was to be a shoe salesman. *He likes to fly. *He declared himself "too math-dumb" to pull Charlotte out of a hole in her Calculus class, when asked if he wanted to call someone when he got hospitalized at Grey-Sloan. *He likes to cook.[[Everyday Is a Holiday (With You)]], x *He likes running and cycling.[[Stronger Than Hate]], x *He kept his important documents in the third drawer of a green cabinet at his place in Minnesota. *The cabin was his first big purchase. He bought it to have a place where he could turn his brain off and relax.[[The Makings of You]], x *His favorite place to do a transplant is San Diego, but his first triple transplant was at Grey Sloan.[[Everything Has Changed]], x *Inconsistent with the [[Mayo Clinic|Mayo Clinic's scrub colors]], he and his transplant team wore maroon scrubs to the [[One Day Like This|organ retrieval]] instead of dark green scrubs. *He had a episode gap between his lone appearance as a guest star and his upgrade to series regular. xNickMarsh.png xNickMarsh.png xNickMarsh.png xNickMarsh.png {{GalleryLink}} These episodes are Nick-centric or are otherwise very informative about his life: *[[One Day Like This]] *[[Here Comes the Sun]] *[[Some Kind of Tomorrow]] *[[The Makings of You]] *[[Stronger Than Hate]] {{Nick Marsh Appearances}} {{Scrollbox}} [[de:Nick Marsh]] {{DEFAULTSORT:Marsh, Nick}} [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:GA Characters]] [[Category:GA S Characters]] [[Category:GA S Characters]] [[Category:GA S Characters]] [[Category:Doctors]] [[Category:Patients]] [[Category:Patients (General)]] [[Category:Patients (Transplant)]] [[Category:Patients (Renal)]]
